episodes.description: Daiquiris are delicious. So delicious that we decided to go down to New Orleans and try to get our hands on as many different daiquiris as we could.

episodes.title: It's Like Vietnam All Over Again
episodes.description: Over the last 50 years war reenactment has gone from something guys at the Elks Club did on the weekend to get away from their wives to a full-blown obsession among history buffs with enough free time to make the experience as true to life as possible. The Vietnam War has typical…

Now he runs his own studio, where he works on sculptural pieces and interior architecture. When we visited, he discussed his creative process and showed us a new piece that he's calling "…

episodes.description: LA darling Deedee Cheriel is a punk rocker turned painter known for mixing iconography from Indian temple imagery, South American political art, and animals in the wild to produce mystical narrative paintings.

episodes.description: Tristan Eaton is a street artist, painter, illustrator, toy designer, and all-around renaissance man. We learn about his career path starting with his skate and graffiti beginnings to being one of the founding members of Kidrobot to running his own creative agency in Los Angeles…

episodes.description: VICE and 42Below recently had the opportunity to collaborate with Brooklyn-based artists FAILE on their permanent installation, The 104 North 7th Project. The piece consists of thousands of handmade tiles designed by the artists, each individually pressed and painted, and then fi…

episodes.description: An artist who makes websites as artworks and sells their domain names.

episodes.description: Justin Lowe and Jonah Freeman create immersive environmental installations that play on ideas of drug culture, psychedelia, architecture, and film.

His desire to create larger pieces and invent unique graffiti tools led to the development of his internationally recognized ink and paint brand Krink Inc…

episodes.description: VICE heads to Mexico to meet up with graphic artist David Piñón Hernández, otherwise known as Seher One. What started as an illegal graffiti hobby at the age of 15 has developed into an extremely successful career as a muralist and graphic designer.

He worked at China Sea (formerly owned by Sailor Jerry), which was ground zero for traditional American tattoos, and at the birthpl…

episodes.description: In 1962, the coalmine beneath Centralia, PA caught fire and it still burns today. We traveled there to find out who stayed behind when everyone else gave up on the place.

episodes.title: Oil of L.A.
episodes.description: Twenty billion barrels of oil sit beneath Los Angeles. Hidden in plain sight, thousands of wells pump day and night all over the city covered by hollow office buildings, camouflaged next to high schools, and concealed behind shopping malls.

episodes.description: Daniel Richter is a German artist who started out designing record sleeves for punk bands in the 80s and evolved into a Saatchi-repped painter loved by all.

episodes.title: Nudie Cohn
episodes.description: Clothing designer Nudie Cohn lit a fire in the country music world with glittering suits and jackets with rhinestone-bejeweled pot leaves and gargantuan uppers and downers. His custom creations for Elvis, Gram Parsons, and Hank Williams are now legendary.

episodes.description: We travel to Indonesia to buy sandals made by former drug addicts. The shoes, called "junkies," are a part of a program started by the YAKITA Drug Treatment Center to help women suffering from addiction learn a marketable skill.

episodes.description: Video footage of pretty people after they've just woken up to stale tequila and regret

episodes.description: Dutch fashion man Koos van den Akker created the Cosby knitwear using his signature Frankenstein style.

episodes.title: The People Vs. Big Night Out
episodes.description: Over the course of the Big Night Out series, host Clive Martin has received a fair bit of abuse via YouTube comments. So we thought it was only fair to give him the opportunity to respond to some of them.
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: The Metal Night
episodes.description: Clive Martin heads to the dark side to investigate the shadowy world of the UK metal scene. In a club with an enormous Satan behind the DJ booth, he meets all the stock characters, from grungers, to goths, to overgrown emo kids, to lipstick lesbian metal chicks.
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: RIP Indie
episodes.description: Clive gets his old Libertines jacket out of the closet and heads to Shoreditch, indie's new London home, and discovers that the scene isn’t quite as he remembered it.
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: The Drunken Student Disco
episodes.description: Setting out on the ultimate night out with the Cardiff University rugby team, Clive must endure the pre-lash, the dirty pint, the Jägerbomb, and the banter. Can he win their acceptance, or will he forever be a "shit-lad"?
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: The Drum 'n' Bass Night
episodes.description: Clive Martin travels to Reading, in Berkshire, England, to breathe in the Lynx Africa body spray at a drum 'n' bass night. The scene has been a rave gateway for generations of British youth and it's still refusing to die.
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: Psytrance Rave in a Forest
episodes.description: After coming across a forest rave deep in the English countryside, Clive Martin finds himself amongst swinging dreadlocks, "poi artists," evil clowns, inexplicably posh Made in Chelsea extras, and a scrotum-headed demon.
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: The Gabber Night
episodes.description: In the first episode of Big Night Out, Clive Martin heads north to Glasgow in search of the dark heart of the UK Gabber scene. To do this he must endure 200 BPM tunes, scores of shirtless men punching the ceiling, hockey mask wearing hardcore fiends, and a man with a rathe…
episodes.author: Clive Martin

episodes.title: I Posed as a Prostitute in a Turkish Brothel
episodes.description: Correspondent Confidential is a series of illustrated documentary shorts narrated by award-winning journalists. For the first episode, photojournalist Mimi Chakarova talks about her journey deep into the underworld of international sex trafficking.

episodes.author: VICE Staff

Maybe a night out will help? Unlikely, with Dalston's numero uno sex vixen, Holly Wood, back on…

episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Eric Dressen - Trailer
episodes.description: When I first saw Eric Dressen I was a little star struck and kind of intimidated. He told me he liked my show and that the Anthony Pappalardo episode was his favorite. That tripped me out. My immediate reaction was "Do you want to do an episode?" He was down, and here we are.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Elissa Steamer
episodes.description: We’re psyched to finally have a female pro skater on the show, and who better than Elissa Steamer, the first female pro skater ever. Two weeks ago we said we wouldn't make a huge deal about her being a lady and all, but it's hard not to. This episode's going to be great.

episodes.title: Elissa Steamer - Trailer
episodes.description: We've wanted to do an Elissa episode for quite some time now, and finally all the planets have aligned to make it happen. Elissa first blew minds out of skull holes over a decade ago in Toy Machine's classic, 'Welcome to Hell.'  Since then, she's  done everything from winning shi…

episodes.title: Eric Koston
episodes.description: Here it is, folks, the "Epicly Later'd" series on the man considered to be the greatest street skater of the modern era. Eric Koston is the standard by which all street skaters are judged.

episodes.title: Eric Koston - Trailer
episodes.description: An inside look at the personal history of the best, and most guarded, street skater of all time.

episodes.title: Arto Saari
episodes.description: Arto Saari's story is nothing short of miraculous. Obviously he's naturally gifted and skated his ass off as a kid, but his rise to prominence is like no one else's.

episodes.title: Arto Saari - Trailer
episodes.description: Back like a bat out hell, Epicly Later'd kicks off its fifth year of production with Arto Saari. Arto's story has it all, from the skate-fairy tale beginning of his career to his awe-inspiring video parts and near death handrail experiences.

episodes.title: Bonus: Behind the Scenes in Photos
episodes.description: A small sampling of the style of photos that inspired the people at VICE to ask Patrick to make a show out of his blog, Epicly Later'd.

episodes.title: Bonus: Jake Phelps
episodes.description: Jake Phelps reminds me of the editor of the Daily Planet in Spider-Man. He just sits there and yells at people all day.

episodes.title: Bonus: Beagle
episodes.description: This episode really embodies what this show is all about.

episodes.title: Bonus: 2007 Original Skate Footage
episodes.description: This week's bonus episode features all the skate footage we shot for the first year of Epicly Later'd.

episodes.title: Bonus: Supreme
episodes.description: This little bonus feature was filmed in late 2006, before the first Epicly Later'd even aired. The video features Javier Nunez leading Patrick on a tour of Supreme LA, all the while giving us insight into his idea of great customer service.

episodes.title: Bonus: Jacob Rosenberg
episodes.description: Jacob Rosenberg was the main man behind the video camera for the first two Plan B videos, Questionable and Virtual Reality. He got his start helping out with H Street videos and the Blind video.

episodes.title: Bonus: Braydon Szafranski in NYC
episodes.description: If this doesn't inspire you to get a satanic themed tattoo, we don't know what will.

episodes.title: Bonus: Bryan Herman's House
episodes.description: This extra from the Epicly Later'd DVD showcases some of the unsafe aspects of pro skaters' home lives: guns, dirt bikes, and a post-car-accident forty to calm the nerves.

episodes.title: Menace
episodes.description: A meet and greet with all of your urban skateboard heroes from the early 90s. Some of these guys have been serving eight-year bids in maximum-security prisons, while others are dedicated family men.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Trailer: Menace
episodes.description: We're finally going to start putting out the Menace episodes.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Ricky Oyola
episodes.description: In part one of the much-anticipated Ricky Oyola series, we finally hear the story behind his coveted Z Rollers and get to meet Ricky's Philly mentor, Roger Browne.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Brandon Westgate
episodes.description: Patrick went up to Wareham and coaxed Brandon Westgate into talking about cranberry bogs, lawn mower parts, and dentists who trade Vicodins for BJs.

episodes.title: Brandon Westgate - Trailer
episodes.description: Next Generation East Coast powerhouse. Three part series starting on Thursday May 12th.

episodes.title: Josh Kalis
episodes.description: How it all got started in Grand Rapids.

episodes.title: Josh Kalis - Teaser
episodes.description: The Josh Kalis series starts next week, and it should be one of the most thorough episodes we have ever done.

episodes.title: Antwuan Dixon
episodes.description: The Antwuan Dixon Epicly Later’d has finally arrived. I think there is good mix of what really happens when you spend the day with Antwuan.

episodes.title: Dylan Rieder
episodes.description: Dylan is the most exciting skater out right now, hands down.

episodes.title: Dylan Rieder Teaser
episodes.description: Starting next week we’ll explore the story behind the only man that could stand up next to Stay Gold

episodes.title: Gonz and Hosoi
episodes.description: The twin kings of vert- and street-skating trade mutual praise.

episodes.title: Agafia's Taiga Life
episodes.description: In 1936, a family of Russian Old Believers journeyed deep into Siberia’s vast taiga to escape persecution and protect their way of life. The Lykovs eventually settled in the Sayan Mountains, 160 miles from any other sign of civilization. In 1944 they had a daughter, Agafia. Today…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Agafia's Taiga Life - Trailer
episodes.description: In 1936, a family of Russian Old Believers journeyed deep into Siberia’s vast taiga to escape persecution and protect their way of life. The Lykovs eventually settled in the Sayan Mountains, 160 miles from any other sign of civilization. In 1944, Agafia Lykov was born into this w…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Faustino's Patagonian Retreat
episodes.description: For this episode of Far Out, VICE went to Chilean Patagonia to meet Faustino Barrientos, one of Lake O'Higgins' most infamous inhabitants. Lake O'Higgins comprises a portion of the border between Chile's Aysén region and Argentina's Santa Cruz province. Since 1965, Faustino

episodes.title: Heimo's Arctic Refuge
episodes.description: Heimo Korth is a hunter and fur-trapper who lives with his Eskimo wife in the middle of Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. That's only, oh, 100 miles from the next nearest human.

episodes.title: Tel Aviv Fashion Week
episodes.description: Charlet and company arrive in the party capital of the Middle East and are treated to a show by Italian fashion giant Moschino. Charlet rubs some fashion people the wrong way by talking about anorexia, and then heads to a restaurant where models are stuffing their faces with food…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Tel Aviv Fashion Week - Teaser
episodes.description: No sooner had the last model left the catwalk than the first rockets to reach Tel Aviv from Gaza in over 20 years started to fall, in reaction to the IDF assassinating Hamas' military chief. We were there throughout it all, trying to make our final episode of 'Fashion Week Intern…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Urban Fashion Week
episodes.description: The CEO of Urban Fashion Week, Billy Bad Ass, holds a casting call and reduces a model to tears. Later on, we're introduced to the first and only black female NASCAR driver. Welcome to Atlanta, aka Black Hollywood.
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Happy Friday from Fashion Week Internationale
episodes.description: From the makers of Fashion Week Internationale, a card to celebrate the passing of yet another week of your life you'll never get back.

episodes.title: Seoul Fashion Week
episodes.description: 'Fashion Week Internationale' lands in Seoul, the technology and entertainment capital of East Asia. Charlet tries and fails to understand why people there shop at 4 AM, gets a makeover on the subway, and meets Donald King, the loneliest punk in the world.
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Caribbean Fashion Week
episodes.description: We arrive in Kingston, Jamaica, and gain an audience with dancehall celebrity Elephant Man, aka The Energy God, to find out why dancehall girls cause local men so many problems. Then we explore the illegal and dangerous skin-bleaching trend.
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Rio Fashion Week
episodes.description: Charlet heads to the sexiest city in the world for Rio Fashion Week and goes on a hunt for ass. She plays "spot the transsexual model" backstage at the shows and invites a 19-year-old transgender prostitute into the VICE bang bus to learn more about the "ins and outs" of her job…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Nigeria Fashion Week
episodes.description: Charlet hops off the plane and meets Lexy Mojo-Eyes, the head of Nigeria Fashion Week and premier model agency "Legendary Gold." Then we're treated to quirky runway walks, the Nigerian definition of "swag," and a sweet serenade from the male models.  We then move onto fashion wee…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Cambodia Fashion Week
episodes.description: We arrive in Phnom Penh and head to the first show of Cambodia's innagural fashion week, where some models hit the runway "acting stoned." It's followed (naturally) by a tranny-zombie after party.

episodes.title: Merry Christmas from Fashion Week Internationale
episodes.description: Enjoy this Christmas card from the makers of Fashion Week Internationale.
episodes.author: Fashion Week Internationale

episodes.title: Las Vegas International Lingerie Show
episodes.description: Charlet delves into the Las Vegas International Lingerie trade show, where sexy lingerie seems to have been overrun by dildos, lube, and chocolate vaginas. She then heads to a training session with Vegas Sin, Las Vegas' all-girl team in the lingerie football league.
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Colombia Fashion Week
episodes.description: VICE heads to Medellin for Colombia Fashion Week. Formerly the old stomping ground of Pablo Escobar, the city is now trying to throw off its powdery legacy and push fashion up the noses of the world. Charlet, your host, goes to two rival fashion weeks running simultaneously and i…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Full Figured Fashion Week
episodes.description: Charlet arrives in New York to attend Full Figured Fashion Week. First on the schedule is a plus-size model competition where aspiring models literally crawl on their hands and knees for the chance to be crowned winner.   Then we check out a plus-size trade show, Curves in the Ci…
episodes.author: VICE Fashion

episodes.title: Islamabad Fashion Week
episodes.description: Charlet travels to Islamabad for Pakistan's second ever fashion week. Despite the constant threat of extremist violence, she discovers a thriving and fabulous fashion industry lead by the irrepressible style guru of Pakistan, Tariq Amin.
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Watch an MMA Champion Kick the Crap Out of a VICE Staffer
episodes.description: Josh Schneider is VICE's go-to guy for eating disgusting concoctions at the Burger King Whopper Bar and writing the blurbs under YouTube videos. So we were a little surprised to hear he was doing MMA training with undefeated MMA champion Andy Singh. This video showcases his gruel…
episodes.author: Josh Schneider

episodes.title: MMA Worldwide - Bulgaria
episodes.description: In this episode of Fightland's series Worldwide, we visit the former Eastern bloc nation of Bulgaria, where twin brothers Rumen and Rosen Dimitrov are building an MMA team by transforming tough guys into fighters.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Pakistan - Part 3
episodes.description: Bashir Ahmad takes us behind the scenes of Pak Fight Club 3, the latest in a series of big MMA nights he's orchestrated in Lahore.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Pakistan - Part 2
episodes.description: Pakistani MMA got its start in an apartment above a real estate office. It's come a long way since. Fightland traveled to Lahore to meet Bashir Ahmad, a professional fighter and founder of the country's first-ever mixed martial arts team, PAK MMA. In part two of the series, Bashi…
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Pakistan - Part 1
episodes.description: Pakistani MMA got its start in an apartment above a real estate office. Fightland travels to Lahore to meet Bashir Ahmad, professional fighter and founder of the country's first-ever mixed martial arts team, PAK MMA.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Ottavia Bourdain
episodes.description: We followed MMA lover, writer, and dedicated Brazilian jiu-jitsu student Ottavia Bourdain for a while to see what life is like when you have a fighter in the family. Her husband, Anthony, is that funny-talking, cigarette-smoking food guy from TV, and he was around for all this to…
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Liz Carmouche
episodes.description: Fightland went to San Diego to meet Liz Carmouche, the woman who made it through the Marine Corps, the Iraq War, and Don't Ask, Don't Tell to get her history-making shot at Ronda Rousey and the UFC women's bantamweight belt.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Daniel Cormier
episodes.description: Fightland travels to the American Kickboxing Academy in San Jose, California, to meet the two-time Olympian as he prepares for his long-awaited UFC debut this weekend.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Before and After: Clay Guida - Part 2
episodes.description: Follow UFC featherweight, and proud Chicagoan, Clay "The Carpenter" Guida through the bowels of the United Center and into the Octagon, where he meets contender Hatsu Hioki.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Before and After: Clay Guida - Part 1
episodes.description: Follow UFC fighter Clay "The Carpenter" Guida as he returns home to Chicago to fight for the first time as a featherweight: from weight cuts to weigh-ins to reunions.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Uriah Hall
episodes.description: The 'Ultimate Fighter' sensation talks about training and getting his mind right before his big fight this weekend.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Worldwide - Macau
episodes.description: The world gets smaller and smaller as MMA pushes into China.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Sitdowns - Royce Gracie
episodes.description: MMA's first and greatest legend, Royce Gracie, talks about introducing the world to Brazilian jiu-jitsu and creating mixed martial arts out of parts.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Sitdowns - Benson Hendersen
episodes.description: The UFC lightweight champion talks about his early days as a fighter and gives a little advice to MMA up-and-comers.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Dustin Poirier
episodes.description: Before his fight this weekend against Cub Swanson in London, UFC featherweight and Louisiana native Dustin "The Diamond" Poirier takes Fightland out on a fishing boat to talk about fighting, self-knowledge, and his new life at American Top Team.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Antonio "Bigfoot" Silva
episodes.description: Tomorrow night, UFC heavyweight Antonio "Bigfoot" Silva takes on legendary Dutch kickboxer Alistair Overeem in the biggest fight of both their careers. Fightland went down to Florida to ask Silva about his victory over the legend Fedor Emelianenko, his humbling loss to Cain Velas…
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets - Ariel Helwani
episodes.description: Ariel Helwani, the self-made and self-styled "voice of MMA," overcame loneliness, introversion, and UFC reluctance to become one of the most recognizable faces in mixed martial arts journalism.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Sitdowns - Global Training
episodes.description: Some of the best fighters in the UFC talk about where in the world they'd like to train.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: MMA in Jordan
episodes.description: In Jordan's capital city of Amman, Palestinian refugee and Brazilian jiu-jitsu master Samy Al-Jamy teaches Jordanians and Muslim seekers from around the world the secrets of mixed martial arts.
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Fightland Meets Tom Lawlor
episodes.description: We went to Providence, Rhode Island, and a bunch of suburbs south of Boston that all sound the same to hang out with UFC middleweight fighter Tom Lawlor. The experience was a mix of hamburgers, philosophical musings, and some other stuff that you'll just have to watch to find out…
episodes.author: Fightland Staff

episodes.title: Laurence Haim in the White House Press Pool
episodes.description: Canal Plus reporter Laurence Haim discusses the frustration involved in trying to explain the complex electoral college to French people, and why Ohio is so important to that process. Some Ohioans she meets support Romney, some support Obama, and some say they won’t vote for eith…
episodes.author: Laurence Haim

episodes.title: An Al Jazeera Reporter in Little Havana
episodes.description: In this episode of 'Foreign Correspondents,' we get a sense of the chaos at the final presidential debate in Miami. Then we follow Al Jazeera correspondent Mohammed Al-Alami as he ventures into Little Havana to do a story on Cuban Americans—that is, if he can pull the locals away…
episodes.author: Mohammed Al-Alami

episodes.title: Laurence Haim at the Hofstra Presidential Debate
episodes.description: i-Télé correspondent Laurence Haim hits the second presidential debate in Long Island, voicing her frustrations about the limited access granted to foreign press and looking forward to joining President Obama on the campaign trail. Laurence and her cameraman then hit the trail wi…
episodes.author: Laurence Haim

episodes.title: A Hong Kong State Radio Reporter at CPAC
episodes.description: China has a one-party system, so Ben has always been bewildered by the pageantry of our elections. Watch as he attempts to wrap his head around one of America's silliest, and most important, traditions.
episodes.author: Ben Leung

episodes.title: Laurence Haim of i>Télé at the Presidential Debate
episodes.description: In the premiere episode of 'Foreign Correspondents,' we examine the the future of journalism in the "Tweetocracy," corporate sponsorship of the American democratic process, and Rudy Giuliani explains why being a socialist in America is a bad thing.
episodes.author: Laurence Haim

episodes.title: Moscow - Trailer
episodes.description: In the next episode of Fresh Off the Boat, Eddie goes to Moscow and falls in love with Russian kabobs, learns the difference between American and Russian vodka, and explores the underlying racial tensions that modern Russian youth are fighting to overcome.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Detroit
episodes.description: Eddie meets up with hometown hero Danny Brown to eat some massive Big Baby burgers and survey the ways in which Detroit has been affected by the economic downturn.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Detroit - Trailer
episodes.description: In the next episode of Fresh Off the Boat, Eddie heads to Detroit to eat Big Baby burgers with Danny Brown and check out the cuisine of America's largest Muslim population in Dearborn. Part 1 will air on Monday, October 28.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Mongolia
episodes.description: In this episode of Fresh Off the Boat, Eddie heads to Mongolia to take part in the Naadam festival, which celebrates the "three manly sports"—archery, horse racing, and Mongolian wrestling. Then he discusses the effects of Mongolia's recent shift to democracy with some cam…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Season Two Trailer
episodes.description: In Fresh Off the Boat season two, Eddie takes you on a global excursion examining cities in transition. From the abandoned Packard Plant in Detroit to migrant Kyrgyz workers in Moscow to the yurts of the Gobi Desert, we see the wreckage that global capitalism has left behi…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Season One Leftovers
episodes.description: Here are the outtakes, behind-the-scenes clips, and bloopers from the first season of 'Fresh Off The Boat.' Enjoy!
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Miami
episodes.description: Eddie takes porn star Jada Stevens to the restaurant Morro Castle for his favorite fritas before witnessing her make a few unsuspecting guys' days—or lives?—in the infamous Bangbus. Welcome to Miami, the food-porn mecca.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Miami - Trailer
episodes.description: 'Fresh Off the Boat' brings you sex, hip-hop, and Haitian food in Miami. Eddie gets a food tour of Hialeah in the back seat of the Bangbus, chows down on some barbecue in the parking lot of a strip club with Uncle Luke, and vibes out on the Biscayne Bay with Chef Creole’s usual S…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Back in Taiwan
episodes.description: In this episode of 'Fresh Off the Boat,' Eddie heads back to Taiwan to get heavy into the heavy metal scene—face paint, screaming lessons, and furry pink pillows. He also tastes Taiwan's famous "little snacks" in Gongguan before debating the pros and cons of Taiwanese independenc…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Back in Taiwan - Trailer
episodes.description: In the next episode of 'Fresh Off the Boat,' Eddie returns to Taiwan and vibes out in the metal scene, judges a cosplay fashion show, and taste tests stinky tofu, all while learning how Taiwanese identity is defined. Part one airs next Monday.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Los Angeles
episodes.description: In the first part of the LA episode, Eddie rolls through Tehrangeles and shops for Persian rugs that cost as much as cars, eats brain and tongue sandwiches, and tests out magical saffron ice cream before ending the night at Little Tehran's most famed hookah spot.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Los Angeles - Trailer
episodes.description: During his LA trip, Eddie combs through the city’s crevices eating Mexican food and saffron ice cream, and barbecues with one of the most legendary lowrider clubs in town. LA never fails to bring the weird and unexpected to the table.
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Taiwan
episodes.description: In the first of three 'Fresh Off the Boat: Taiwan' episodes, Eddie gets hopped up on betel nut, surveys his favorite delicacies at the Shilin night market, and goes late-night shrimping. We found ourselves in some interesting scenarios, and they all highlight the endearing sense
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Taiwan - Trailer
episodes.description: In the second episode of 'Fresh Off the Boat,' Eddie goes on a whirlwind adventure in Taiwan and reconnects with his roots. We laughed, we cried, we had a sword fight with chocolate covered dill waffles. We made friends, we made enemies, and of course, we ate. Part One premieres
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Bay Area
episodes.description: Eddie's first stop in the Bay Area is Oakland, where he hangs with a local biker gang that shows hipsters how to shoot guns and hunt for rabbit. After a few gruesome hours in the Oakland outback, they head back to the clubhouse to shoot the shit, throw back a few cold ones, and t…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: Season One Trailer
episodes.description: Raw, wild, and heartfelt, Eddie Huang gets down in the underbellies of cities around the world in search of what's cooking in their back alleys and underground spots. He’s hunting rabbits with biker gangs in Oakland, eating seafood and surfing in Taiwan, hitting low-rider BBQs in…
episodes.author: Eddie Huang

episodes.title: The Warrior Women of Asgarda
episodes.description: The ladies of Asgarda are self-proclaimed descendants of the legendary Amazon warrior women who, according to myth, once roamed parts of what is now Ukraine. We traveled to the Carpathian Mountains in Western Ukraine to attend one of Asgarda’s recruitment camps, where the ladies…
episodes.author: Milene Larsson

episodes.title: Welcome to Hell... in Norway
episodes.description: Hell is a quaint little village in Norway. There are red-roofed houses, a post office, a grocery store, even a church. It literally freezes over during the winter. There's also the Blues in Hell Festival, which this year brought a host of legendary blues singers to Hell, includin…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Black Bike Week
episodes.description: Black Bike Week is a bike rally that happens every year in South Carolina over Memorial Day weekend. Once a year the traffic comes to a standstill as the streets fill with brightly customized sports bikes, with their riders taking advantage of the state’s "no helmet" law to perfo…
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Kingdom of Germany
episodes.description: Former chef and martial arts trainer Peter Fitzek has founded his own micronation called the Kingdom of Germany. It consists of several properties around the city of Wittenberg, south of Berlin, and has 25 citizens, its own currency, an official state limousine, and passports.
episodes.author: VICE Germany

episodes.title: Heroin Holiday
episodes.description: Every August, while Europe's desk jockeys shut off their phones and head to the beach, the junkies of Prague set up camp in the poppy fields outside the city for a vacation of their own. For one glorious month, there are no cops to run from, no dealers to skirt—just acres of verm…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Heroin Holiday - Trailer
episodes.description: Every August, while Europe's desk jockeys shut off their phones and head to the beach, the junkies of Prague set up camp in the poppy fields outside the city for a vacation of their own. For one glorious month, there are no cops to run from, no dealers to skirt—just acres of verm…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Mr. Hálek's Fungus
episodes.description: Václav Hálek is the world's most prolific composer of mushroom songs. As in the songs they sing to him. The mushrooms. Because God asked them to.
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: UFO Welcome Center
episodes.description: Jody Pendarvis is a kooky southern gentleman who has built a ramshackle UFO welcome center in his backyard in rural Bowman, South Carolina. If aliens happen to land around Bowman, they'll be greeted by Jody, who claims he'll be able to talk to them, and his homemade alien spacecr…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Teenage Exorcists
episodes.description: Sick of taking responsibility for the shitty things that have happened to you in your life? Help is on the way, in the form of three Bible-thumping teenage exorcists who claim to be able to exorcise people's "sexually transmitted demons."
episodes.author: Charlet Duboc

episodes.title: Portrait of a Russian Oligarch
episodes.description: After the collapse of Communism in Russia, as state assets were divvied up and privatized, a few individuals stepped in to take the reins of this entrepreneurial experiment. Rewarded with massive fortunes and fame, they came to be known as "the oligarchs." To see how the .00001%
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: Cowboy Capitalists
episodes.description: For maverick entrepreneur Ian Cox, Africa is the last frontier of free enterprise. In 2012 he nabbed a lucrative United Nations contract to transport equipment from South Africa to South Sudan, a country on many countries' embargo list. The other problem: the journey north entail…
episodes.author: Tim Freccia

episodes.title: Deportee Purgatory
episodes.description: About 40 percent of Mexican immigrants deported from the US are sent back through Tijuana. Many of the deported border crossers have established a makeshift shantytown inside a dry, concrete riverbed where the Tijuana River once flowed—called 'El Bordo.' A camera crew from VICE M…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: The Warrior State
episodes.description: Guerrero is one of the poorest states in Mexico and the site of some of the worst violence in the battle between the drug cartels and Mexican authorities. As a result of the violence, hundreds of civilians have armed themselves with machetes, rifles, and shotguns, put masks on, a…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: Mexico's Other Border
episodes.description: When traveling from Central America to Mexico, immigrants are forced to battle corrupt Mexican police, drug cartels like the infamous Zetas, and human traffickers, all before they even come close to the United States border. We tagged along with a group of Central American immigr…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: The Man Who Eats Roadkill
episodes.description: "I ate a badger once that someone else had picked up because they wanted its skull. It was blown up like a horse on the Western Front and smelled rather horrible. When I cut into it, the flesh was green but nevertheless I persevered and stewed it. It made the house smell like the…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Guns in the Sun
episodes.description: Weeks before the almost unfathomable mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary in Newtown, Connecticut, VICE editor-in-chief Rocco Castoro visited Florida to dive headfirst into its byzantine firearms laws and discover why his home state was the first in the nation to issue over one…
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: Venom Superman Responds to YouTube Comments
episodes.description: Last week we premiered a documentary about Steve Ludwin, a nutty guy who injects himself with snake venom as a means to becoming immortal. It was a YouTube hit, and received thousands of comments, such as "This﻿ guy is pretty cool" and "You look like you have AIDS. Do﻿ you?" Here…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Venom Superman
episodes.description: For the past 20 years Steve Ludwin has been sticking deadly snake venom in a syringe and mainlining it. He claims that snake juice is the ultimate pick-me-up, making him stronger, faster, and more resilient. And now, it looks like mainstream scientific research might be catching
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Bush League Rebels
episodes.description: On my first day embedded with the UN stabilization force in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, I visited a camp in the city of Goma set up to house rebel combatants who had recently surrendered. The facility was split along ethnic and administrative lines, with only a chain-li…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: BREAKING: Exclusive Footage of John McAfee Detained in Guatemala
episodes.description: About an hour ago John McAfee was picked up by the Guatemala special police task force for questioning about his illegal entry into the country. His lawyer, Mr. Guerra, accompanied him to Emigrason Albergue in Guatemala City and is attempting to get John out before his press conf…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: On the Run with John McAfee (Teaser)
episodes.description: VICE editor-in-chief Rocco Castoro and photographer/videographer Robert King have been following John McAfee for the past five days, documenting his life on the run. Here is a small taste of the footage they have taken.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: Taxidermy Babe
episodes.description: After meeting Divya at a party in Brooklyn, we assumed she was into artisinal pickles and free-range tempeh. Turns out, killing animals and stuffing them is more her thing. We decided to go to the woods with her and have some fun with a woodchuck. Well, it wasn't really fun for t…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: War Gin
episodes.description: Ugandans are the hardest drinking Africans in the motherland, both in terms of per capita consumption and the hooch they choose to chug. Waragi, or "war gin," is what they call the local moonshine, and it makes the harshest Appalachian rotgut taste like freaking Bailey's.
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Death of the American Hobo
episodes.description: We traveled by freight train to the 112th National Hobo Convention in Britt, Iowa, to see what was left of hobo life. We felt as if we were a pair of early Americans—pioneers far from home on a great adventure. Each train was a roll of the die, a unique and unpredictable experien…
episodes.author: Aaron Lake Smith

episodes.title: Joe Crow Ryan
episodes.description: We met up with Joe Crow Ryan, a well known NYC subway musician who uses music to overcome struggles with homelessness and the law. He's unemployed, and not looking, because he's "done with jobs."

episodes.title: The Rosaire Family Circus
episodes.description: We spent some time with the Rosaires, a tenth-generation circus family. Their animal sanctuary in Sarasota, Florida is an impressive collection of lions and tigers and bears and breastfeeding chimps, oh my!

episodes.title: Cult Kids: Westboro
episodes.description: We followed the story of the Westboro Baptist Church. They welcomed us into their homes and gave us access to 17 years of home video footage. In return, we produced an unbiased look into the lives of one of America's most despised organizations.

episodes.title: How to Sell Drugs
episodes.description: We learned the secrets of a big-time NYC drug dealer—from how his crew operates to where he gets his dope.

episodes.title: Shopping with Genesis P-Orridge
episodes.description: Genesis Breyer P-Orridge is a man/woman of many faces, both literally and figuratively. The pandrogynous father/mother of industrial music, Genesis was a founding member of both Throbbing Gristle and Psychic TV.

episodes.title: A Wanderful Experience
episodes.description: Vice magazine associate editor Rocco Castoro attends a "wanding party" where people attempt to sell a $300 magic wand that they claim fixes bad backs and makes wine taste better.

episodes.title: Viva Skate
episodes.description: Chris Nieratko and 15 skaters sneak into Havana, Cuba with the sole intention of bringing skateboards to the children of the forbidden island.

episodes.title: How to Build a Mini Ramp with Billy Rohan
episodes.description: Billy Rohan walks us step-by-step through the building of a mini ramp that will service a couple thousand partygoers.

episodes.title: Anarchist Cookbook
episodes.description: VICE whips up a few recipes from the Anarchist Cookbook.

episodes.title: Sabersegging
episodes.description: The two pinnacles of human technological achievement, lightsabers and Segways, together at last.

episodes.title: Apocalyptic Dinner for One
episodes.description: You're not going to be able to get a cheap bucket of chicken from KFC when most of the population has been horribly radiated to death, so you'd better get yourself acquainted with those scary, doesn't-even-have-a-sell-by-date foods at the back of your cupboard.
episodes.author: Jaime Gonzalo

episodes.title: Filipino Blood Stew
episodes.description: The Philippines! The jewel of the orient, purveyors of the greatest hip-hop dance troupes, and probz the most colonized place in the world. But although I'm a proud half-Filipina, the cuisine has always left me wondering "WTF"?! So to conquer my fears and appease my mother, I dec…
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Vegan Meat Feast Pizza
episodes.description: I realized vegans are always super grumpy because they've been deprived the pleasures of junk food. So I made a big slab of vegan comfort food that won't leave them alone with a rumbling tummy while all their animal-eating pals are out stuffing their faces.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Drunken Jerk Chicken Patty
episodes.description: London's West Indian Notting Hill Carnival is the best. Its only downside (apart from all the crime, LOL!) is the overpriced food that's sold to white people with cultural guilt. So, every year I like to whip up a portable jerk chicken patty and save my money for booze.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Cornershop Cocktails
episodes.description: Who says you can't get crunk on cavity-inducing hooch too?

episodes.title: Olympic Energy Nachos
episodes.description: To keep up with all the high-octane Olympics watching you'll be doing on your sofa that stinks of cigs, Doritos, and spilt Guinness, here's a tasty take on the TV treat that is nachos. Only these are jam-packed with all the magic medicines that athletes use to stay pumped up.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Fake Cheese Cheesecake
episodes.description: A dairy extravaganza that'll put your after-dinner cheeseboard to shame.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Mini Fried Chicken Hors d'Oeuvres
episodes.description: Dirty fried chicken doesn't have to be from Popeye's at 3 AM on a Friday night.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: English Breakfast Cupcakes
episodes.description: Time to cook ourselves some baked goods with real balls.

episodes.title: Sizzurped Cherry Pork
episodes.description: Uniting the American South's two finest delicacies: Slow-cooked pig and DJ Screw's drank of choice.

episodes.title: Diamond Jubilee Picnic
episodes.description: A feast to rival the Queen's very own Diamond Jubilee spread.
episodes.author: Joanna Fuertes-Knight

episodes.title: Popping Candy Pavlova
episodes.description: A mega-meringue that will conjure up nostalgia from kiddy-hood to the awkwardness of puberty.

episodes.title: Za'atari Refugee Camp
episodes.description: The Za'atari refugee camp in Jordan is a disturbing reflection of just how bad the civil war in Syria has gotten. When it opened, Za'atari had just 100 families. Today, it has about 120,000 residents. Located 18 miles south of the Syrian border, it's the fourth largest city in Jo…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Aleppo's Child Nurse
episodes.description: As Assad’s troops and the FSA battle in the middle of Aleppo, Dar al-Shifa’a hospital serves as the only option for birthing mothers. VICE photographer and videographer Robert King recently visited the hospital, where he met and interviewed a 14-year-old boy nurse who helps deliv…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Turkey
episodes.description: Journalist Tim Pool recently joined the VICE editorial staff to cover breaking news, and his first assignment was to fly down to Istanbul and produce a live stream of the protests against the constructio…
episodes.author: Tim Pool

episodes.title: The Pillaging of the Umayyad Mosque
episodes.description: On October 13, 2012, Aleppo's Umayyad Mosque, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the oldest mosques in the world, suffered extensive fire damage amid fierce fighting between President Bashar al-Assad's forces and the Free Syrian Army. Photographer and videographer Robert Kin…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Syria
episodes.description: Last year VICE commissioned photographer and videographer Robert King to document the civil war that has been ravaging Syria for the past two years. Largely based on Aleppo, Robert's footage of the violent conflict that continues to unfold in the region is perhaps one of the most…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Snipers of Aleppo
episodes.description: Over the last six months the FSA and the battle for Aleppo has transitioned from a full-on frontline assault into a slow-paced but still deadly sniper war. Photographer and videographer Robert King recently returned to the conflict-ravaged city to meet the snipers of the FSA, int…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Mali - Under Sharia Law
episodes.description: When the jihadist group MUJAO took control of northern Mali's city of Gao from Tuareg rebels last September, many locals welcomed the return of law and order. But the security MUJAO offered came at a price: a harsh interpretation of Islamic law that saw public beatings and amputa…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mali - France Vs. Jihad
episodes.description: Back in February, the only way to reach the city of Gao in northern Mali was to hitch a ride with the French convoys that rolled through the desert every few days. Along the way, a VICE production crew made friends with some French soldiers and chatted with them about what they t…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mali
episodes.description: 'Ground Zero - Mali' was shot in Gao, Mali, on February 21, 2013. It's basically the first legitimate combat footage to come out of the war there. Normally the French ban journalists from the frontlines and film a sanitized version of the fighting themselves and then distribute i…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Syria - The Free Syrian Army
episodes.description: During his time in Syria throughout much of 2012, videographer Robert KIng followed Aleppo's Al-Tawhid Brigade as he dodged bullets and rocket fire to learn more about the largest brigade of the Free Syrian Army. Somehow Robert managed to track down Haji-Mara, the Al-Tawhid Briga…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Syria - The Bombing of Aleppo's Dar al-Shifa Hospital
episodes.description: On November 21, Aleppo's Dar al-Shifa Hospital was bombed and destroyed by the Syrian Army. This is the same makeshift hospital where, weeks ago, VICE photographer and videographer Robert King reported on human rights abuses and war crimes against the patients (including children…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Syria - Under Fire for Bread in Aleppo
episodes.description: Every day the men, women, and children of Aleppo, Syria, must risk their lives to stand in line and hope that they can buy a kilo of bread to survive another day. Many of the bread factories in Aleppo have been destroyed amidst fighting between the Free Syrian Army and Assad's tr…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Syria - Aleppo Field Hospital
episodes.description: The atrocities and war crimes currently ripping Syria apart at the seams are evident at a field hospital in Aleppo, the country's largest city. Inside the hospital exhausted doctors indescriminately treat civilians, members of the Free Syrian Army, and captured Syrian Army troops…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Syria - The Burning of the Old Souk
episodes.description: Amid a fierce battle between Assad's security forces and Free Syrian Army insurgents, fire swept through the old Souk of Aleppo, a historic covered market and World Heritage site. Rebel fighters and activists have reported that the blaze was sparked by the use of incendiary morta…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Syria - Al-Qusayr Field Hospital
episodes.description: VICE commissioned renowned war photographer and videographer Robert King to embed with the ragtag troops of the Free Syrian Army in Aleppo, smack dab in the heart of a conflict that is ripping Syria apart. This footage was shot inside a field hospital in al-Qusayr that serviced b…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Syria - Trailer
episodes.description: VICE commissioned renowned war photographer and videographer Robert King to embed with the ragtag troops of the Free Syrian Army in Aleppo, smack dab in the heart of a conflict that is ripping Syria apart. He returned with footage that has made us very scared and very sad for the…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Ambien Effect
episodes.description: Ambien has been prescribed to millions of insomniacs, yet most people are seldom aware it also possesses the ability to normalize functioning in certain types of damaged neurons, a phenomenon called "the Ambien effect." The first awakening occurred in 1999 when a man who had spen…
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Tanks for the Memories
episodes.description: With comedian Joe Rogan as his guide, Hamilton Morris travels across the United States seeking new heights of sensory deprivation. In part one, he investigates what happens to the mind, body, and spirit while inside the tank.
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Tanks for the Memories - Trailer
episodes.description: With comedian Joe Rogan as his guide, Hamilton Morris travels across the United States seeking new heights of sensory deprivation. The full episode is coming soon to Vice.com.
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Hamilton and the Philosopher's Stone
episodes.description: In the bucolic pastures of Hazerswoude-Dorp, Holland, nestled in verdant fields of ruminating Holsteins, lazy windmills, and pert tulips, lies a quaint Dutch farm that functions as the world's largest psilocybin-containing-truffle factory.
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Getting High on Krystle
episodes.description: There is no facile synthesis of the events that transpired at the Wamego missile silo between October 1 and November 4, 2000. The available information is a viscous solution of truths, half-lies, three-quarter truths, and outright lies, the fractionation of which yields no pure p…
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Getting High on Krystle - Trailer
episodes.description: At the dawn of the millennium all of the inhabitants of the worlds largest LSD laboratory were arrested, except one...Krystle Cole.
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: Nzambi
episodes.description: Hamilton goes to speak with Wade Davis, author of The Serpent and the Rainbow, world renowned ethnobotanist and (don't call him a) Zombieologist.

episodes.title: SiHKAL: Shulgins I Have Known and Loved
episodes.description: An epic love-fest on the man who birthed Ecstasy in a test-tube.
episodes.author: Hamilton Morris

episodes.title: The Icelandic Skin-Disease Mushroom Fashion Fiasco
episodes.description: Sent to Iceland on the pretense of covering fashion week, Hamilton Morris and VICE take the opportunity to instead search the country for its native psychoactive mushrooms.

episodes.title: The Sapo Diaries
episodes.description: VICE heads into the Amazon on a hunt for its most hallucinogenic tree frogs, but federal agents, monster bugs, and an inept shaman keep getting in the way.

episodes.title: John John Florence
episodes.description: John John Florence is between homes right now. He gave us a tour of the garden and treehouse at his old place, and then a walk-through of the beautiful North Shore abode he's about to move into.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Clark Little
episodes.description: We remember looking at photos of him surfing Oahu's Waimea shorebreak as a kid and wondering what the hell he was thinking. Now, several years later, he's taken his once-novice photography skills to the gallery level.
episodes.author: Bertie Brandes

episodes.title: Carissa Moore
episodes.description: We met Carissa Moore at the ass crack of dawn to go surfing and make some sandwiches, but she forced us to come to her trainer's house and work out before feeding us.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Typhoon Surfers
episodes.description: California-based pro surfer Alek Parker travels the world in search of monster waves caused by hurricanes. He recently visited Japan to catch the big waves that only happen once a year during typhoon season, and we followed him around with a camera.
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Mavericks
episodes.description: Here's the triumphant return of 'Hi Shredability.' Tyler Manson headed out to Santa Cruz and spoke with some locals who have surfed the legendary Mavericks break. He interviewed six surfers, including big-wave champion Darryl "Flea" Virostko, about the first time they heard of th…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Andy Davis
episodes.description: Hi Shredability profiles quintessential surf artist, Andy Davis, who began with aspirations of being a pro-surfer but quickly discovered his artistic talents.

episodes.title: Harley
episodes.description: Pro surfers Chris Christenson and Brad Gerlach ride across country on Harley motorcycles.

episodes.title: The Pipemasters
episodes.description: Hi Shredability covers the third leg of Vans' Triple Crown of Surfing event in Hawaii--one the most challenging and revered big-wave competitions in the world.

episodes.title: Thomas Campbell
episodes.description: Hi Shredability explores artist Thomas Campbell's deep and rich history within the skating and surfing world.

episodes.title: Chad Marshall
episodes.description: Chad Marshall and Scott Anderson have been working together since surfboards were neon. In the past year Scott's been working on some weird new designs and Chad gets to play test pilot.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Creative Destruction
episodes.description: Creative Destruction is a series of web videos made by a couple assholes from Australia whose sole intention is to make the rest of the world jealous of their travels.

episodes.title: Grain Surfboards
episodes.description: Jake Burghart gets in the van with Mikey Detemple and Hi Shred veterans Scotty Stopnik, and Kassia Meador to travel up the coast to Southern Maine.

episodes.title: Dane Reynolds
episodes.description: Dane Reynolds may very well be the best free surfer in the world.

episodes.title: Cycle Zombies
episodes.description: VBS rides, skates and surfs with Cycle Zombies Scotty, Rat, George and Turkey - a punk rock band with well-rounded extracurricular activities.

episodes.title: North from New York
episodes.description: Like “Sideways”, but on motorcycles and with surfers. And in New England.

episodes.title: Searching for Montauk
episodes.description: Bombing the Williamsburg Bridge and taking the Long Island railroad with the late-night BAT crowd.

episodes.title: Mike Black
episodes.description: When I think of Mike Black, I think of a mix of old-school surfing, advanced mathematical theory, and his drug influenced experimental art and films.

episodes.title: Matt & Ford Archbold
episodes.description: Archy is one of those classic, iconic figures in surfing who represents everything punk little groms want to be.

episodes.title: Mike Stewart
episodes.description: Mike Stewart is the hardest working filmer in all of surfbusiness.

episodes.title: Myles Padaca
episodes.description: Myles Padaca takes his groms out surfing on the North Shore.

episodes.title: Mark Cunningham
episodes.description: The North Shore’s greatest bodysurfer.

episodes.title: Kassia Meador
episodes.description: Our favorite lady-surfer takes us on a bike ride around Brooklyn.

episodes.title: Chris Christenson
episodes.description: Chris Christenson makes surfboards out of his Cardiff, California workshop that are so crazy and avant shaped it’s like, Ahhhhhhh!

episodes.title: Rockaway Beach
episodes.description: Hi-Shredability takes the A-train to NYC’s greatest surf spot and Ramones song.

episodes.title: Robin Kegel
episodes.description: The young gun of the board-shaping industry shows

episodes.title: Dan Malloy
episodes.description: The youngest of the Bros. Malloy forsakes competitive glory to support the Ventura, CA, surf scene.

episodes.title: Ry Craike
episodes.description: Western Australian surfer Ry Craike undergoes massive culture shock at the Huntington Beach US Open.

episodes.title: Alex Knost
episodes.description: Progressive surfing and band practice with the Japanese Motors.

episodes.title: How to Make Lunch with Julia Ziegler-Haynes
episodes.description: Welcome to our brand new how-to series called How To, where we’ll learn to achieve a wide range of cooking and drinking techniques, recipes, and anything that won’t light our hair on fire (unless that’s part of the plan).
episodes.author: Julia Ziegler-Haynes

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to the Venice Biennale
episodes.description: Every two years, Venice hosts the most important contemporary art exhibition in the world. Over a period of six months, the Biennale welcomes over 375,000 visitors and raises millions of Euros. We went to Venice a few months before the official opening to meet artists, curators,
episodes.author: VICE Italy

episodes.title: Three Days of War
episodes.description: Historical Florentine Football is an extremely violent sport that originated with the birth of Florence itself. Father to both soccer and rugby, it is played by "calcianti": men, mostly from Florence, who play for honor, glory, and passion. Nobody gets a penny.
episodes.author: VICE Italy

episodes.title: Mondo Movies
episodes.description: Together with Gualtiero Jacopetti and Paolo Cavara, Franco Prosperi is responsible for the five documentaries that gave birth to the much-maligned subgenre known as "mondo film": 'Mondo Cane,' 'Mondo Cane 2,' 'La Donna nel Mondo,' 'Africa Addio,' and 'Addio Zio Tom' (aka Uncle To…
episodes.author: VICE Italy

episodes.title: Jesus Factor
episodes.description: Our documentary about an Italian talent show that promotes Evangelical Christian music in a Catholic country.
episodes.author: VICE Italy

episodes.title: Mr. Button
episodes.description: Franco Jacassi has ten million buttons, give or take a few.

episodes.title: Dear Cronaca
episodes.description: Cronaca Vera (True Chronicle) began in 1969 as a tabloid magazine about Italian crime. Printed on low quality stock, in black and white, and sold at the cost of one euro, Cronaca Vera consists of 15 stories--crazy, depressing, hilarious, local and national, but all of them true.

episodes.title: Gabriella
episodes.description: Kids Telling Dirty Jokes is our new series that features tiny comedians we found on Craigslist. The second episode stars Gabriella, who looks like an adorable, little angel but is actually a foul-mouthed baby heathen.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Talin
episodes.description: Kids Telling Dirty Jokes is our new series that features tiny comedians we found on Craigslist. The premiere episode stars Talin, who looks like a sweetie but is actually the devil.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Partners and Spade
episodes.description: Partners & Spade are masters of the public spectacle and prominent NYC tastemakers, but nobody really knows how to apply a job title to what they actually do.

episodes.title: The Kuchars
episodes.description: George and Mike Kuchar are preternatural fraternal twins who have been making oddly amazing motion pictures for over 50 years.

episodes.title: Bompass and Parr
episodes.description: You don’t need to be Sacco & Vanzetti to know that nothing ups the fun factor more than having a buddy around to get in trouble with.

episodes.title: Duckie Brown
episodes.description: Fashion designers Steven Cox and Daniel Silver show us around the world of Duckie Brown.

episodes.title: Cool and Dre
episodes.description: Hanging out in the studio with Dade County's top producing duo.

episodes.title: Yacht
episodes.description: We head northwest to catch Yacht at home on a rare day off before they hit the road yet again.

episodes.title: David Icke and the Lizard Apocalypse
episodes.description: We travel to the Isle of Wight to meet the most iconic conspiracy theorist on Earth, David Icke. Icke discovered that a race of shape-shifting lizards has been masquerading as presidents and monarchs for centuries while planning to crush the planet.
episodes.author: Kevin Morpurgo

episodes.title: Tech Talk 1 of 5
episodes.description: Comedian Jon Benjamin presents: VHS tapes found in the attic filled with 1980 cable access gold.

episodes.title: Tech Talk 2 of 5
episodes.description: Comedian Jon Benjamin presents: VHS tapes found in the attic filled with 1980 cable access gold.

episodes.description: Comedian Jon Benjamin presents: VHS tapes found in the attic filled with 1980 cable access gold.
