episodes.title: Kimchi Seafood Soup
episodes.description: For the second episode of our pretty much brand new food show, Matty Matheson's Hangover Cures, we took Matty to Montreal to get smashed with the brilliant Antonio Park, just so they could make a spicy seafood kimchi soup the next day.
episodes.author: VICE Canada

episodes.title: Hakka Style Comfort Food with Nick Liu
episodes.description: For the premiere episode of VICE Canada's first original food show, we took our host Matty Matheson out to Markham—a Toronto suburb known for excellent Chinese food. After an insane night out, our guest Nick Liu cooked us an amazing comfort food meal to vaporize Matty's hangover…
episodes.author: Matty Matheson

episodes.title: The Subway Gangs of Mexico City
episodes.description: Local gangs known as combos made up of reguetoneros (“reggaeton fans”) in their late teens and early 20s haunt the subway stations of Mexico City. Most combos are guilty of general rowdiness and huffing chemicals in public, like American greasers and heavy metal fans, but they’re…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: Oaxaca's Third Gender
episodes.description: Every November a celebration known as the Vigil of the Authentic Intrepid Searchers of Danger takes place in the city of Juchitán, Oaxaca, in Mexico. In this community of Zapotec indigenous people, it's generally understood that there are men, there are women, and there are muxes…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: Jaime Maussan and the Third Millennium
episodes.description: Jaime Maussan is Mexico's leading ufologist. His TV show, 'Contact,' has run for decades, and he consistently packs auditoriums where he enlightens audiences with his knowledge of the cosmos and life on other planets. He has many detractors, of course, and he's no stranger to bei…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: The Messenger Angels of Ciudad Juárez
episodes.description: For the past three years, a group of teenagers calling themselves the Messenger Angels have been taking to the streets of Ciudad Juárez covered in silver paint and glitter, wearing thick white robes and huge feathered wings, and holding hand-painted signs that address the cops, t…
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: The Cumbiaton Super Stars of Mexico City
episodes.description: A group of Mexico City DJs known as "Under Style" has come together to create a new sound based on reggaeton and cumbia that they call Cumbiaton. Ignored by the affluent crowd, and often criticized for the fashion and dance styles of their fans, the Cumbiaton DJs are super stars
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: New Jerusalem
episodes.description: La Nueva Jerusalén is a millenarian and messianic town located in the western state of Michoacán, Mexico. Its residents are faithful to the Virgin of the Rosary and believe the end of the world is coming soon, and only they will be saved.
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: Life After Food
episodes.description: Soylent is a sci-fi-inspired nutrient shake, and for an entire month it was the only thing I ate. Here's what happened over the course of my 30-day deep dive into the Silicon Valley-driven future of food.
episodes.author: Brian Merchant

episodes.title: Life After Food - Trailer
episodes.description: I lived on nothing but Soylent, the futuristic food replacement, for 30 days straight. Watch the full documentary next week on Motherboard.
episodes.author: Brian Merchant

episodes.title: The DIY Cyborg
episodes.description: Humanity just made a large, DIY step towards a time when everyone can upgrade themselves towards being a cyborg.
episodes.author: Max Hoppenstedt

episodes.title: The Electric Superbike of the Future
episodes.description: The Mission RS is the most advanced electric motorcycle in the world. It sounds like a spaceship and hauls ass like one too. But the question is, when will this high-performance technology trickle down to cheaper models and more potential buyers?
episodes.author: Motherboard Staff

episodes.title: Al Gore Explains Why Civilization Might Not Survive the Next 100 Years
episodes.description: Climate change is running rampant, our politics are infected by moneyed interests, and corporations control our media. Al Gore sits down with Motherboard to explain two possible futures he sees for humanity.
episodes.author: Brian Merchant

episodes.title: Long Shot: Inside the Scope of Smart Weapons
episodes.description: Watch Motherboard's new documentary on smart weapons, the gamification of warfare, and a laser-guided robo-rifle that aims itself.
episodes.author: Motherboard Staff

episodes.title: This Is What Happens When You Launch a Slice of Pizza into Space
episodes.description: It's a drone! It's a solar plane! It's... a single slice of classic cheese 'za mounted to a weather balloon that's pumping EDM into the heavens? When we caught wind of what the band Anamanaguchi had cooking for their new video, we had be there to see it take off.
episodes.author: Motherboard Staff

episodes.title: High Country
episodes.description: There are fortunes to be made in the Silicon Valley of weed. In part one of 'High Country,' Motherboard goes to Denver to check out next-gen, cannabis-extraction tech, size up weed crowdsourcing and the contradictory science of the plant, and smoke dabs.
episodes.author: Brian Anderson

episodes.title: High Country - Trailer
episodes.description: Motherboard heads west to learn about America's green rush. Here's a trailer for their new documentary about the highs and lows of America's budding, tech-enabled cannabis industry. 'High Country' will air on Monday, June 3.
episodes.author: Brian Anderson

episodes.title: Click, Print, Gun: The Inside Story of the 3D-Printed Gun Movement
episodes.description: Cody R. Wilson is a 25-year-old University of Texas law student who is working to build semiautomatic weapons using a 3D printer. Cody is an articulate and tech-savvy mouthpiece for the fight against gun control. I flew down to his home base of Austin, Texas, with a Motherboard f…
episodes.author: Erin Lee Carr

episodes.title: 'Click. Print. Gun.' (Trailer)
episodes.description: Cody R. Wilson has figured out how to print a semiautomatic rifle from the comfort of his own home. Now he's putting all the information online so that others will join him. Our documentary 'Click. Print. Gun.' investigates this groundbreaking technology and how it is changing th…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: The Space Suit Makers
episodes.description: When they first met in 2007, Ted Southern and Nik Moiseev came from two very different worlds. They didn't imagine they'd eventually be in business designing space couture in a modest studio at the Brooklyn Navy Yards.
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Valley of the UFOs
episodes.description: We ventured to Hooper, Colorado (population: 105) to investigate some of the stranger things that have gone down there—from shooting stars to strange weather patterns to aliens descending to Earth in extraterrestrial space pods.
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: The Space Composer
episodes.description: As we started planning the second season of our 'Spaced Out' series, we wanted to feature non-scientists thinking about the future of space. Enter composer Robert Alexander, who is helping NASA make new discoveries by turning raw data into music through a process called Data Soni…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Libya in Vitro
episodes.description: Last summer, we met Mohammed and Nadia, a couple from Tripoli who had left their distressed home for six months to live in Jordan. They hoped to conceive through in vitro fertilization with the help of one of the country's best doctors, and full backing of the Libyan government,
episodes.author: Matt Yoka

episodes.title: Open Source Outer Space
episodes.description: Anyone with enough brains and balls can build their own rocket and fly it to space. Or at least that’s what the nonprofit, open-source space-project Copenhagen Suborbitals wants the world to realize. They're determined to create the first homemade, manned spacecraft to go into su…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Drone On
episodes.description: From weapon expos in Jordan to idyllic California beaches, we caught up with the people who are building and selling unmanned aerial vehicles all over the world, and even convinced a few companies to let us take their flying spy robots for a spin.
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: The Satellite Hunter
episodes.description: Thierry Legault is not your average amateur astronomer. He’s a renowned astrophotographer, painstakingly chronicling the orbits of planets, distant galaxies, spaceships, and—to the chagrin of the intelligence community—the spy satellites we’re not supposed to see.
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: The Silent Dish
episodes.description: In 1956, the National Radio Astronomy Observatory was formed in rural Green Bank, West Virginia, and became the hotbed of radio astronomy in the United States. But now, with cell phones, wi-fi, and radio stations emitting massive amounts of radio waves, doing research at the NRAO…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: The Guy Who Hunts Space Bears in Rural Virginia
episodes.description: Mike Shaw is a quiet, unassuming man who's in love with the wilderness, and he knows more about tardigrades than almost anyone. These microscopic creatures, whose name comes from the German for “slow walker,” and who are sometimes called “water bears” because of their bear-like g…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Justin Warner Makes a Salad for the Apocalypse
episodes.description: Justin Warner is a Food Network Star who's been getting the attention of New York’s trendy tastebuds from his Bed Stuy, Brooklyn, restaurant Do or Dine. The restaurant’s DIY aesthetic, which pairs the better parts of bohemian living with hip hop couture, features unconventional…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Blowing Up Asteroids with Neil deGrasse Tyson
episodes.description: What are the chances of an asteroid colliding with earth and causing hundreds of millions of people to drown in tidal waves the size of skyscrapers? For this piece, we talked to science's No. 1 booster, Neil deGrasse Tyson, about what it would take to stop an asteroid from hittin…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Plus Pool
episodes.description: A few dudes in Brooklyn think swimming in New York's rivers is a cool idea, so they're planning to build a plus sign-shaped pool, appropriately named Plus Pool, that will float in the city's surrounding waters. What's nuts is the thing will actually be filled with river water tha…
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Experimental Music with Dan Deacon
episodes.description: It's two parts "Bill Nye," 1.5 parts "Meet the Band" and 100 percent awesome.

episodes.title: A Death on the Frontier
episodes.description: The unprecedented hunt for the the Higgs boson or "God particle" may have  culminated at Europe's largest particle accelerator, but it was the product of an effort that began thousands of miles away at another atom smasher beneath the Illinois prairie.
episodes.author: Alex  Pasternack

episodes.title: Spaced Out: The Artstronaut
episodes.description: Nicholas Forker is a maestro of the ballpoint pen. One day I was walking by the half-way open door of his art studio in Bushwick and noticed astronauts on the wall. Drawings and ink paintings of astronauts in a variety of mundane positions – sitting on the couch, batting up on a…
episodes.author: Hugo Perez

episodes.title: I Was a Teenage Cryonicist
episodes.description: Seventeen-year-old Matthew Deutsch is planning to brain freeze himself and his dogs into eternity.
episodes.author: Motherboard

episodes.title: Spaced Out: Making Mars with Tom Sachs
episodes.description: Artist Tom Sachs has recreated an entire four-week mission to Mars with little more than wood, glue and household objects. Working with Nasa and the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, his studio built go-kart rovers, a model rocket, and a giant lunar excursion module to turn the fabled P…
episodes.author: Alex  Pasternack

episodes.title: Ultra-Orthodox Internet
episodes.description: Citi Field was sold out recently, but not for the Mets. Motherboard TV's Alex Pasternack investigates an anti-internet rally.
episodes.author: Alex  Pasternack

episodes.title: Spaced Out: Outer Space Interior Design
episodes.description: A look at the next generation of space vehicles headed for Mars, near-Earth asteroids, and beyond.
episodes.author: Lam Thuy Vo and Sean Yeaton

episodes.title: Whoopi Goldburger
episodes.description: W.P. Gold Burger, a.k.a. Whoopi Goldburger, is a no-nonsense burger joint in the Shibuya district of Tokyo. It was founded by Shogo and Taiji, who have been buddies since grade school and are not actually fans of Ms. Goldberg's work.
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Alexei Zimin
episodes.description: All the stories you hear about Russians and drinking are true; anyone who says otherwise is a liar. And most of the stories you hear about chefs and drinking are true, too. With that in mind, Moscow's Alexei Zimin was everything we hoped a Russian chef would be.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Xemei
episodes.description: The Best Place in Barcelona to Get Drunk and Forget About How Underpaid You Are
episodes.author: VICE Spain

episodes.title: Josh Ozersky
episodes.description: We first met food writer Josh Ozersky while filming our Michael White Munchies episode. Josh showed up to the shoot with a half-eaten sandwich and then proceeded to order some pasta before we headed to three more r…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Hopgood's Foodliner
episodes.description: Situated in the middle of Toronto's Roncesvalles neighborhood—a historically Polish area that's now been gentrified—Hopgood's Foodliner imports the energy and flavor of Canadian Maritimes cuisine and chefs it up slightly. We took the Hopgood's crew out to one of their favorite re…
episodes.author: VICE Canada

episodes.title: Drunk Chefs Made Us Ramen Burgers in Tokyo
episodes.description: For VICE Japan's second Munchies episode we hung out with American-born ramen fanatic Keizo Shimamoto, head chef at renowned ramen joint Bassanova in Shindaita Station, Tokyo. Keizo and his fellow ramen obsessives Boom and Hiroshi took us on a whistle-stop walking tour of
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Daniel Castaño
episodes.description: When Colombians get together, they roll deep. So when we went to Bogotá to sample former Mario Batali-pupil Daniel Castaño's classical Italian fare at his restaurant, Emilia Romagna, we brought a big-ass bus to cart around the crew. And true to form, we filled the bus with a rowd…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mexicali Taco & Co.
episodes.description: For the second ever Munchies episode shot in LA, we chose the gentlemen from Mexicali Taco & Co., Esdras Ochoa and Javier Fragrosso. We wanted to do an episode on Mexicali because we stopped by there after a shoot a few months back and were blown away by how good the food
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Andrew Zimmern
episodes.description: You might know Andrew Zimmern from his Travel Channel show 'Bizarre Foods' in which he wolfs down unsightly things halfway across the world. Maybe you've wondered what eats when he's out with friends in New York. For this episode of 'Munchies,' Andrew chose to start at Osteria Mo…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Hatos Bar
episodes.description: Our buddies from VICE Japan hung out with the crew from Hatos Bar in Tokyo's Naka-Meguro neighborhood. Hatos Bar serves up American-style pit barbecue at its best. Owners Sou Ieki and Dubrai showed us their favorite places to go out and then got wasted before cooking up some barb…
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: The Marrow
episodes.description: Going into this episode, I thought that because of Harold's experience with filming, this was going to be a piece of cake, and he would drop everything to tell the camera about how his love of cooking evolved from an early age, and blah blah blah, etc., etc. Instead, for the firs…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Bar Isabel
episodes.description: Grant van Gameren doesn't necessarily want to hear that Bar Isabel, his new restaurant in Toronto's Little Italy, is Spanish or Mediterranean, even though that's basically what it is. So what we can say without offending anyone is that it serves an amazing whole grilled octopus,
episodes.author: VICE Canada

episodes.title: Walter's
episodes.description: So you're an all-American boy, and you meet a potential sex partner who doesn't seem terrible on OkCupid. After the second date things are looking pretty decent, and now you need a not-too-expensive place to go for dinner and drinks that also has to be super casual so you can wea…

episodes.title: Craft
episodes.description: James Tracey might be the coolest chef we have ever shot for 'Munchies.' We were shocked by how relaxed he is considering he's the executive chef at Craft and Colicchio & Sons. He likes his razor clams raw and his beer cold. He also likes Il Buco Alimentari & Vineria, Motor City,…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Blue Hill
episodes.description: This 'Munchies' episode is going to make whatever you eat today look like shit. It features chef Trevor Kunk of Blue Hill, one of the early bastions of farm-to-table cooking in New York City. The food Trevor and his team put out is revelatory: Their parsnip steak and salt-baked r…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Enrique Olvera
episodes.description: Enrique is not afraid to mix ants with mayonnaise and coffee and put it all on ears of baby corn. The 14-course tasting menu at his restaurant, Pujol, is considered by many to be the finest in Mexico.
episodes.author: VICE Mexico

episodes.title: Joe Beef
episodes.description: 'Munchies' finally touches down in Montreal, the boozy, food-loving birthplace of VICE. Joe Beef co-owner David McMillan takes us on an insanely delicious food tour of the city that ends with a wood board covered in smoked meat. Enjoy.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Jonathan Benno
episodes.description: Jonathan Benno is head chef of Lincoln Ristorante, a modern Italian restaurant in the heart of Lincoln Center. He's worked with Thomas Keller at The French Laundry in Napa Valley and at New York’s Per Se. For this episode of 'Munchies,' Benno chose to visit chef Nick Kim, who tra…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Best Pizza
episodes.description: How cool would it be if pizza delivery guys wore capes? Bill Meier, who delivers pies for Williamsburg's Best Pizza, is thinking of rocking one as he bikes around town, and we couldn't support him more. In this episode of 'Munchies,' we follow Bill and Best Pizza's owner, Frank P…

episodes.title: Guu Izakaya
episodes.description: Toronto's Guu Izakaya is a rare restaurant for a few reasons. It's the only place we know of where the staff happily shouts at you as soon as you enter the door. It's also one of the few Japanese spots in the city that's actually run by Japanese people.

episodes.title: The Black Hoof
episodes.description: Headed up by mastermind Jen Agg and her chef de cuisine, Brandon Olson, Toronto's The Black Hoof is known for its giant charcuterie boards, tuna with sweetbreads, horse tartare, and foie gras with Nutella.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Meatball Shop
episodes.description: Daniel Holzman and Michael Chernow are two meatballs from Manhattan who love meatball subs. In this episode of 'Munchies' we do what we always do with our rising-star chefs: check out their food, go out and get them drunk, and then come back to their restaurant and make them cook…

episodes.title: Emma Hearst
episodes.description: In this episode of Munchies we follow Emma Hearst of Sorella and her business partner Sarah Krathen along with pastry chef Yarisis Jacobo to Mesa Coyoacan in Williamsburg for enough tequila to kill a burro. The night is capped off by a return to Sorella to feast on Yarisis's fabu…

episodes.title: Battersby
episodes.description: The chef-owners of Battersby, Joe Ogrodnek and Walker Stern, take their jobs very seriously. They also take drinking Fernet Branca very seriously. In this episode of Munchies, these two gentlemen grabbed their sous chef Mike Sowa and headed to Henry Public and then Brooklyn Socia…

episodes.title: Kyle Bailey
episodes.description: Who better to be the first chef in 'Munchies' from our nation's capital than a guy with a Slayer sticker on his sausage grinder? Kyle Bailey is the chef at Birch & Barley, one of DC's best restaurants.

episodes.title: Brandon Jew and Brett Cooper
episodes.description: A lesson in left-handed cooking.

episodes.title: Anthony Bourdain
episodes.description: The 'No Reservations' host takes us on a brass-knuckled culinary tour of New York.

episodes.title: Jeff Michaud
episodes.description: Pigging out with the chef and co-owner of what might be America's only Italian Gastropub.

episodes.title: Brad Spence
episodes.description: Ah, Philadelphia: the city is beautiful, the people are honest, and the food scene is unreal. One of the people responsible for this is Brad Spence, who helms Philadelphia's finest trattoria, Amis.

episodes.title: Christina Tosi
episodes.description: Holy fucking cereal milk! This is the sweetest episode of Munchies we've ever done.

episodes.title: Metal Church
episodes.description: Outside Bogotá, Colombia, the Communidad Pantokrator meets every Saturday to rock out in the name Jesus Christ. We spent an enthralling evening in Pantakrator's mosh pit of raw emotion and got a glimpse of how some cast off rockers have found resurrection in the crashing cymbals…
episodes.author: Krishna Andavolu

episodes.title: The Only Record Store in Mauritania
episodes.description: While filming in Africa we passed through Nouakchott, Mauritania, and decided to stop in the country's only record store, Saphir D'or. Turns out, it rules! We chatted with Ahmede Valle, shop proprietor and seasoned DJ, about record collecting and the unifying powers of music.
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: The Huayno Murders
episodes.description: Bad things are happening in Peru's biggest music scene.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Neomelodics
episodes.description: Trefft Alessio, den Star dieses knalligen, stark-gebräunten Soundtracks zu Neapels von der Mafia beherrschten Ghettos.

episodes.title: Donk Uncut & Uncensored
episodes.description: VICE travels to Bolton to meet Blackout Crew, the stars of working class Northern England's most popular music scene: Donk.

episodes.title: Donk Uncut & Uncensored - Trailer
episodes.description: Together for the first time UNCUT and UNCENSORED, VBS presents Donk, an hilarious look at what happens when you drive a Blur fan up to Wigan and throw him a nightclub full of topless bodybuilders

episodes.title: Black Lips In Israel
episodes.description: The Black Lips make their way through Israel.

episodes.title: Heavy Metal Gangs of Wadeye
episodes.description: VBS travels into Australia's outback in search of the aboriginal youth gangs of Wadeye, all of which have taken their name, dress, and overall attitude from the 1980's and 90's golden age of heavy metal.

episodes.title: Heavy Metal Roadshow
episodes.description: VBS correspondent Iano Dovi conducts a comprehensive survey of today's heavy metal scene in London, Stockholm, and Los Angeles.

episodes.title: Black Lips Video Premiere
episodes.description: A new video from VICE Records' very own raucous pioneers of mushroom tea-steeped garage rock.
episodes.author: Andy Capper

episodes.title: Black Lips in India
episodes.description: Atlanta’s Black Lips embark on a missionary trip to the psychedelic motherland. But is India ready for flower punk? Or will the subcontinental authorities make them martyrs to the cause?

episodes.title: Donk
episodes.description: We explore the North England Donk scene, the lowest common denominator of British dance music.

episodes.title: True Norwegian Black Metal
episodes.description: An introduction to the Black Metal scene of Bergen, Norway.
episodes.author: Ivar Berglin

episodes.title: Buchaman
episodes.description: Buchaman is Uganda’s most popular crippled dancehall musician and shadow VP.”

episodes.description: VBS recently tagged along with Brooklyn’s Birthday Boyz on an unprecedented tour into the hinterlands of China’s underground rock scene

episodes.description: Shanghai’s Super Girl

episodes.description: VICE visits the Republic of Kazantip, an annual month-long rave/orgy on the southern coast of the Ukraine.

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Partying with Einstein
episodes.description: Einstein is the nicest dude in the world, he is also a bit of a hustler. We were a bit concerned that this party was a lot fucking bigger in dude’s head than it was going to be in reality. It turned out to be one of the best parties we’d ever been to, and everyo…

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Ce' Cile's Dub Plate
episodes.description: Jamie-James meets up with Ce’Cile and convince her to do a dub plate on an unreleased beat by Jammer.

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Chico at King Jammy's
episodes.description:
VICE founder Shane Smith meets Chico outside King Jammy studios in the Waterhouse neighborhood of Kingston. Chico describes growing up in Kingston, the slow spread of dancehall culture around the world, and the Jamaican love for all things “hard.”
...

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Vybz Kartel
episodes.description: For all for the lily-white warnings about staying out of Kingston when we traveled to Jamaica, everyone we met there was super nice and light-years more helpful and friendly than your average New Yorker. The only time I was legitimately scared on our whole trip was meeting

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Dancehall Princesses
episodes.description: VBS meets Ce’Cile, Delishus, and Spice, the ladies of Dancehall.

episodes.title: Vice Kills Jamaica - Assassin's Video Shoot
episodes.description: VBS correspondent Jamie Hodgson visits Assassin on the set of his new wild-western-Jamaican-gansters-themed video and attempts to blend in with the extras.

episodes.description: New Orleans Bounce

episodes.description: Mexican telenovela legend Raferi Negrette's boy band sings, dances, cleans, cooks and tends to his every need.

episodes.description: The world knows Valeria Lukyanova as the girl who turned herself into a real-life Barbie doll. Controversy has surrounded her every move since her computer-perfect visage went viral last year. What most of the world doesn't know, however, is that Valeria is not a real girl at all…

episodes.description: The world knows Valeria Lukyanova as the girl who turned herself into a real-life Barbie doll. episodes.title: The Man Behind @DadBoner
episodes.description: We caught up Mike Burns, the comedic genius, VICE contributor, and fully grown man-child behind the @DadBoner Twitter phenomenon. We watched some WWE, drank a few domestos (that means beer), and talked about the internet, comedy, comedy on the internet, and online humor.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Web 1.0 Music of Jerome LOL
episodes.description: Jerome LOL is a young artist who found his niche in reappropriating GIFs and images from the early days of the internet—a time he calls web 1.0. His work hits a certain nostalgic nerve, and if you remember Rihanna's 'SNL' performance with the dolphins in the background, then you'…

episodes.title: The Real Cat Ladies of Minneapolis
episodes.description: While in Minneapolis for the first-ever Internet Cat Video Film Festival, we hung out with a few ladies who take their cats very seriously. Meet our new friends Squirrel the Kitten, Rex the Cat, Vanessa, Kai + Ro, Whitney, Lucien, and Artemis.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Cat Yoga with Feline Experts
episodes.description: We did cat yoga at the Center for Feline Studies and spoke with two feline experts about why cats on the internet are so addictive. Cat yoga is just like regular yoga, only there's a cat on your back pawing away all your negative energy.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Shoenice22 Will Eat Anything for Fame
episodes.description: YouTube sensation Shoenice22 has spent the last two years eating and drinking everything from sticks of deodorant to tampons to full bottles of grain alcohol. He's an older, more self-destructive version of that weird kid at camp who would eat worms for attention.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Keyboard Cat Guy
episodes.description: Keyboard Cat Guy made cats famous online and changed the way you think about the internet and procrastinate at your boring job.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Lil Bub and Andrew WK's Special Holiday Message
episodes.description: The holiday season is a time for giving and bringing together all kinds of different people, beasts, and beings. This year, VICE has a special holiday message from our favorite celebrity feline, Lil Bub, and our favorite partier, Andrew WK. It's awesomely cute, super bizarre, and…
episodes.author: Lil Bub and Andrew WK

episodes.title: World's Fattest Mom
episodes.description: After years of getting paid to scarf down tacos and pizza on "fat fetish" cam sites, Donna Simpson reached an astonishing 600 lbs. She's now desperately trying to lose weight in order to lead a normal life for the sake of herself and her children.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Reply Girl
episodes.description: Ladies who show a little cleavage to get a lot of views on YouTube.

episodes.title: Rachel Rabbit White
episodes.description: Sex writer Rachel Rabbit White thinks fucking is so great that she spends a lot of her time writing about it (and occasionally having it).

episodes.title: The Gregory Brothers
episodes.description: The Gregory Brothers have had tremendous success with Auto-Tune the News. We met the group to find out how they got started, what it's like being a YouTube star, and what they have planned for the future.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Leroy Troy
episodes.description: In this episode of Guitar Moves, Matt Sweeney meets master of the clawhammer banjo Leroy Troy to learn how to cut some monkeyshines.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Cass McCombs
episodes.description: In the tenth episode of Guitar Moves, Matt Sweeney meets singer-songwriter Cass McCombs, who simply can't discount the value of his two thumbs.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Albert Hammond, Jr.
episodes.description: Matt Sweeney meets Albert Hammond, Jr. of the Strokes and discusses 90s-style riffs, influences, and impressing your mom.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - St. Vincent
episodes.description: In episode eight of Guitar Moves, host Matt Sweeney sits down with Annie Clark a.k.a. St. Vincent.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Jake Bugg
episodes.description: UK singer-songwriter Jake Bugg is only 19 years old, but he's already carved a spot for himself in the contemporary Brit-pop landscape. This is due in no small part to his virtuosic guitar playing, so we trekked over to Amsterdam to discuss "Flamengo"-style guitar, DADGAD tuning,…
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Noisey Raps - Trinidad James, the Underachievers, Fredo Santana, and Lil' Reese
episodes.description: In episode 4 of Noisey Raps host Wilbert L. Cooper meets some of the hottest MCs on the scene including Trinidad James, the Underachievers, Lil' Reese, and Fredo Santana. Just try and keep up.

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Dean Ween
episodes.description: We recently drove out to New Hope, Pennsylvania to hang out with Dean Ween (né Michael Melchiondo, Jr), who co-founded avant-stoner royalty act Ween back in 1984. Matt Sweeney set up shop in Dean's sweltering shed to learn some timeless lessons about the guitar.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Cowboy Jack Clement
episodes.description: In the fifth episode of Guitar Moves, we meet the legendary Cowboy Jack Clement, one of the greatest country western and rock and roll songwriters and producers of the 20th century. "Cowboy" Jack Clement has been one of the most significant figures in country music for the past 5…
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Dan Auerbach
episodes.description: In the fourth episode of Guitar Moves, we sit down with blues rock god Dan Auerbach of the Black Keys and learn the secrets of slide guitar.
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Heavy Dicks - Wino: Veteran of Chaos

episodes.description: In the third episode of Guitar Moves, we sat down with Queens of the Stone Age's Josh Homme in a sweltering Los Angeles garage to talk polka guitar and make fun of solos.

episodes.title: Guitar Moves - Blake Mills
episodes.description: Known in some circles as the best guitarist on the planet, Malibu native Blake Mills was already making waves at the tender age of 19. episodes.title: Guitar Moves - The Stooges' James Williamson
episodes.description: On the first episode of Guitar Moves, Matt Sweeney heads to Berkeley, CA to meet the Stooges' James Williamson. He learns about the history of the Stooges, the "Nashville Tuning," and how to achieve the bone-crushing guitar tone on "Search & Destroy."
episodes.author: Matt Sweeney

episodes.title: Heavy Dicks - Drinking Cough Syrup with Weedeater
episodes.description: This video is the first episode of our new metal show, Heavy Dicks. In it, our valiant hosts Fred Pessaro and Jake Boyle join Weedeater's Dixie Dave to sample a well-curated selection of fine cough syrups and artisanal cheeses.
episodes.author: Fred Pessaro and Jake Boyle

episodes.title: Parquet Courts - "Light Up Gold Road Trip" (Documentary)
episodes.description: Former Motherboard editor Sean Yeaton used to walk around the VICE offices carrying a Bunsen burner and saying stuff like, "Drones are the future!" Then his band, Parquet Courts, took off and he was like, "Working at a computer all day is the pits! I'm going on tour." Here's a do…
episodes.author: Noisey Staff

episodes.title: Bot'Ox Featuring Anna Jean - "The Face of Another"
episodes.description: Here's an animated ditty with people wearing masks and humping each other and walking around all dazed and sad. Imagine if the audience at 'Sleep No More' started making out and then boning all over the place—that's sort of what's going on here.

episodes.title: Style Stage: A Documentary About Hair, Style, and Music
episodes.description: Little Richard's pompadour, Michael Jackson's Jheri curl, whatever is happening on top of Diamond Rings—bands' and fans' personal styles have pushed music and culture forward in a major way. This documentary shines a light on the past and present of music, hair, and style.

episodes.title: Snoop Lion Ft. Angela Hunte - "Here Comes the King"
episodes.description: We shot this video in the Trident Castle in Port Antonio, Jamaica. VICE co-founder Suroosh Alvi took us there over New Year's to get the 'Reincarnated' teams of VICE and Snoop's management company, Stampede, together over the festive period. It was the best time ever.

episodes.title: Noisey Raps - The Long Live A$AP Tour

episodes.title: Black Lips Tour the Middle East
episodes.description: Black Lips just finished a trailblazing tour of the Middle East that included shows in Lebanon, Egypt, United Arab Emirates, and Cyprus. Noisey sent a camera crew to document the band's international journey of rock diplomacy. Here's what they came back with.

episodes.description: We interviewed three enigmatic solo artists—Leviathan, Striborg, and Xasthur—who produce black metal on the margins of society. These are men who don’t just play the music, but also embody what it reflects: isolation, misanthropy, and anger.

episodes.description: Billy Childish on Nazis and the death of professionalism. In this edition of Soft Focus UK, Ian sits down with Billy Childish, easily the most prolific Western artist of the past century. He’s been in some ten or so bands, founded a school of poetry, founded a school

episodes.title: Kevin Shields
episodes.description: Kevin takes us through the technical minutia behind MBV’s crazy bendy dream-sound. In this edition of Soft Focus Ian sits down with the man behind My Bloody Valentine’s deafening and dreamy reimagining of guitar music who talks to us ab…

episodes.title: Mark E. Smith
episodes.description: Mark E. Smith apologizes for English TV. In this special Mancunian edition of Soft Focus Ian sits down with Mark E. Smith, singer and only continuous member of the Fall, to talk about his role in foreseeing Manchester’s biggest brush with terrorism to date and his wan…

episodes.title: Andrew W.K.
episodes.description: Andrew W.K. on composing his unique brand of non-judgmental music. In this edition of Soft Focus Ian sits down with Andrew WK and they discuss AWK’s transition from twiddling knobs in obscurity to producing the most accessible music ever know…

episodes.title: Chan Marshall
episodes.description: Cat Power’s Chan Marshall gets loose with Ian.

episodes.title: Genesis P. Orridge
episodes.description: Genesis P. Orridge, the creator of the very idea of industrial music and leader of Throbbing Gristle, Psychic TV, and COUM Transmissions sits down to talk about consciousness shifts and shopping.

episodes.title: Henry Rollins
episodes.description: Henry Rollins and Ian Svenonius begin a week’s worth of witty repartee, touching at first on government surveillance and Henry’s appearance on Australia’s terrorism watch list. Henry tells us about his work for the USO and recount…

episodes.title: Ian Mackaye
episodes.description: Mythic DC punk rock figures Ian Mackaye and Ian Svenonius in a friendly, funny, compelling debate.

episodes.title: Shane Smith
episodes.description: During a trip to Yemen to meet with Al Qaeda and other rebels, Spike and Shane flew to an island just off the coast of Somalia. While there, Spike decided to film an in-depth interview with Shane about the history of VICE, from its inception to the launch of VICE.com. Then they w…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Opening Ceremony
episodes.description: The always fashionable feature-film director Spike Jonze sat down recently with the owners of Opening Ceremony.

episodes.title: Tell Them Anything You Want
episodes.description: A Portrait of Maurice Sendak by Lance Bangs and Spike Jonze. DVD out now!

episodes.title: Shane Smith
episodes.description: Director Spike Jonze cuts Vice founder Shane Smith’s hair and discusses the making of Where the Wild Things Are.

episodes.title: Kanye West
episodes.description: VBS’s creative director Spike Jonze hangs out in the editing suite with Kanye West.

episodes.title: M.I.A.
episodes.description: VBS’s creative director Spike Jonze spends Saturday in London with Sri Lanka’s most famous emigrant, M.I.A.

episodes.title: Thom deVita
episodes.description: Thom began tattooing in the mid 60s in New York City's Lower East Side when it was illegal. There isn't much information out there about him. So we interviewed Ed Hardy and others to tell his incredible story.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Valerie Vargas Bonus: A Visit with Lal Hardy
episodes.description: When we filmed the Valerie Vargas 'Tattoo Age' series, she took us to meet the legendary English tattooer Lal Hardy. Lal has been tattooing since 1975 and is generally considered to be one of the people who elevated tattooing in the UK in the 1980s. Lal is also an amazing storyte…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Thom deVita - Trailer
episodes.description: Thom is an artist on many levels, and tattooing is just one of the ways he expresses himself. He began tattooing in New York City in the late 60s, when the practice was illegal. In this episode, which starts on November 21, we will hear from Don Ed Hardy, Nick Bubash, Scott Harri…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mutsuo
episodes.description: This series revolves around an artist named Mutsuo who tattoos at the world-famous Three Tides Tattoo in Osaka, Japan. Mutsuo went from being one of the shop's first customers to its first apprentice, and now he is considered its most senior tattoo artist.

episodes.title: Mutsuo - Trailer
episodes.description: Mutsuo tattoos at Three Tides in Osaka, Japan. In his episode, you'll hear from Chris Garver, Masa Sakamoto, Hiroshi Hirokawa, and Nami about how Mutsuo learned to tattoo in pretty much every style.

episodes.title: Valerie Vargas
episodes.description: Valerie Vargas grew up in Scotland, but has lived and worked in London for the last five years. You can find her at Frith Street Tattoo in SoHo, where she's known for doing the prettiest “lady heads” in the world. Valerie has only been seriously tattooing since 2007, so she's pro…

episodes.title: A Short Film from Tattoo Age
episodes.description: Here is a short film brought to you by 'Tattoo Age.' Shot on location in the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn, it stars Troy Denning and Dan Santoro in a Film Noir- and James Bond-inspired scene.

episodes.title: Season 2 Trailer
episodes.description: 'Tattoo Age' is back. We traveled to London and Osaka and even all the way to stinky Manhattan to interview three talented tattooers, including old master Thom deVita, who was working in New York City back when tattooing was illegal in all five boroughs.

episodes.title: Freddy Corbin
episodes.description: In the first installment of the Freddy Corbin series, we get familiar with Freddy's tattoos and see his two Oakland tattoo parlors, Temple and Tattoo 13.  Freddy's style is explained by his right hand man and fellow tattooer, Jason Mcafee. We also get a chance to speak with anoth…
episodes.author: Tattoo Age

episodes.title: Trailer: Freddy Corbin
episodes.description: The subject of the Tattoo Age season finale is none other than Freddy Corbin. Freddy has been tattooing for over 27 years and was at the vanguard of modern tattooing. He's known throughout the tattoo world as a spiritual person, and his spirituality is sometimes reflected in the
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mike Rubendall
episodes.description: Mike Rubendall is different than all the artists we've featured so far on Tattoo Age.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Trailer: Mike Rubendall
episodes.description: In this teaser we hear from Frank Romano, Mike's tattoo mentor, about how Mike has achieved his success. Part 1 airs on Wednesday, October 5th.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Series Trailer
episodes.description: Tattoo Age is the new series that takes an inside look at the craft of tattooing.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Troy Denning
episodes.description: In Part 1 of the Troy Denning Tattoo Age series, we strive to keep up with Troy as he struts around town with his new drinking vessel.  We also learn about the unique artist that is Troy Denning, and how he has taken his personality and manifested it into one of the best tattoo p…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Troy Denning Teaser
episodes.description: Troy Denning is a tattoo artist who is not afraid to speak his mind.  Luckily for us, what he has to say is both hilarious and insightful.  Episodes begin Wed. September 7.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Grime
episodes.description: In the first installment of Grime's series we hear from tattoo luminaries, Civ and Chris O'Donnell, as they put in perspective how revered and unique Grime's style is.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Dan Santoro
episodes.description: Part One of Tattoo Age finds us at Smith Street Tattoo Parlor getting to know Dan Santoro.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Broken Bells' Mysterious Short Film, "After the Disco"
episodes.description: To celebrate the forthcoming release of their second full-length record, Broken Bells made a dreamy short film, casting Anton Yelchin and Kate Mara to play star-crossed lovers in an otherworldly landscape.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Pelle Cass's Single Frame Time-Lapse Photography
episodes.description: Time-lapse videos are addictive because they function like magic, allowing us to view change and evolution at a rapid speed, regardless of Grandfather Time's rules.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Behind the Scenes of the Short Film 'Box' by Bot & Dolly
episodes.description: Last week design and engineering studio Bot & Dolly revealed 'Box,' an awe-inspiring short film presenting never-before-seen robot-powered projection mapping on moving objects.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Four Tet Discusses Making Music and His Inspirations in a New Documentary
episodes.description: In an exclusive documentary, produced by The Creators Project, Dan Wilde shows us how Kieran Hebden's personal life—his wife, his sister—impacts on his records and also his all-encompassing approach to creativity: which is essentially "music as life"—the two, for him, are one and…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Watch Sleigh Bells' New Video for "Bitter Rivals"
episodes.description: Noise-makers Alexis Krauss and Derek Miller are back. Sleigh Bells, in conjunction with The Creator's Project, produced a video for "Bitter Rivals," the first single off their forthcoming record of the same name.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: 'This Must Be the Only Fantasy' by Rodarte and Todd Cole
episodes.description: Magical realism, 1980s video games, and haute couture come together in a new film collaboration between fashion house Rodarte and filmmaker Todd Cole, produced by The Creators Project. This Must Be the Only Fantasy stars Elijah Wood and is a VFX-driven ode to fantasy role-…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Exploring the Varied and Vintage Sounds of Washed Out's 'Paracosm'
episodes.description: For his new album, 'Paracosm,' due out August 13, electronic artist Washed Out (a.k.a. Ernest Greene) took an entirely new direction from the purely sample-based work he'd previously made. 'Paracosm' was crafted using over 50 different instruments—and it's not just the amount tha…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: The Collective Mood of China Expressed as Monumental Light Display
episodes.description: Nature and Man in Rhapsody of Light at the Water Cube was unveiled last month at the Beijing National Aquatics Center (known as the Water Cube). The installation uses a computer program to translate the I Ching and the collective mood of the Chinese people, through
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Phoenix Released a New Music Video with The Creators Project
episodes.description: The video features two film crews tackling the impressive task of continuously swapping shots every 25 seconds. It becomes a kind of cinematic relay race as filming passes back and forth between the two crews. While one camera shoots, the other preps the next scene. When the time…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Harvey Moon's Drawing Machines
episodes.description: How does a cricket become an artist? Try placing it in one of Harvey Moon's drawing machines where its movements will be tracked by a camera and turned into original works of art. He makes these "happy collaborations" in his Chicago studio where he creates the system, a set of ru…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Start Your Wet, Hot Summer at MoMA's Rain Room
episodes.description: Initially installed at the Barbican in London, Rain Room became the most successful piece in the museum's history, offering visitors the chance to stand in the middle of a rainstorm without getting wet. The crowd-pleasing exhibition is now on view in New York at MoMA as pa…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Takashi Murakami on Nuclear Monsters and Buddhist Damnation
episodes.description: Takashi Murakami's art has always sat at the crossroads of Japanese tradition and contemporary culture. Often working in sculpture and painting, he recently ventured into the world of cinema with 'Jellyfish Eyes,' a monster movie set in a post-Fukushima world.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Turning CCTV Footage into Art
episodes.description: We're constantly being spied on by closed-circuit television cameras, those electronic eyes peering down at us and monitoring everything we do. But as Orwellian as it all seems, this invasion of privacy and erosion of our civil liberties can serve as a source for art. Art like Ti…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Jon Hopkins's 'Immunity' Soundtracks a Series of Stunning Microscopic Images
episodes.description: Small is beautiful. And nowhere is that phrase more relevant than in the work of artist Linden Gledhill. Trained as a biochemist, Gledhill is now a photographer who likes to take photos of the world in close-up. Like, real close-up. In a collaboration with art director Craig Ward…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Paul Williams
episodes.description: We've been taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. In episode eight we speak with Oscar-winning composer Paul Williams. As well as winning an Academy Award he was also nominated a number of times, most notably for his song…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: DJ Falcon
episodes.description: We've been taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. DJ Falcon (a.k.a. Stéphane Quême, or Bob, as he's known to Daft Punk) is an old friend of theirs who formed a band with Thomas Bangalter called Together, releasing the son…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Chilly Gonzales
episodes.description: For the past few weeks we've been taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new Daft Punk album. For episode six, we spoke with piano man extraordinaire Chilly Gonzales.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Panda Bear
episodes.description: We're taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. In episode five we speak with Noah Lennox, a.k.a. Panda Bear from Animal Collective. He recalls the first time he heard Daft Punk's music late one night on MTV when he caught t…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Creating the Post-Apocalyptic Sky World of 'Oblivion'
episodes.description: While CGI undeniably allows for scenes which might be impossible to film, there's another way of doing FX. And that's using in-camera special effects, which are essentially created in front of the camera rather than added in post. A recent example of this is the effects created f…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Pharrell Williams
episodes.description: In a new series, with direction from Ed Lachman, we're taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. For episode three we spoke with Pharrell Williams.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Nile Rodgers
episodes.description: We've been taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. In episode three we speak with guitarist, virtuoso producer, and frontman of disco-funk band Chic, Nile Rodgers.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Todd Edwards
episodes.description: In a new series, with direction from Ed Lachman, we take a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. In episode two we speak with innovative American producer and godfather of UK garage, Todd Edwards.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Daft Punk's 'Random Access Memories' Collaborators: Giorgio Moroder
episodes.description: In this new series, The Creators Project is taking a look at the collaborators behind 'Random Access Memories,' the new album from Daft Punk. In episode one we speak with legendary Italian producer Giorgio Moroder.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Behind the Scenes of Leo Villareal's Monumental Light Sculpture 'The Bay Lights'
episodes.description: On March 5, San Francisco’s Bay Bridge lit up with 25,000 LED lights courtesy of Leo Villareal’s installation 'The Bay Lights.' The huge light sculpture will be illuminating the bridge for the next two years and locals will get to see a magnificent display every night.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: The Incredible Light Art of the Kinetica Art Fair
episodes.description: A 5,000-pixel, shimmering LED sphere, illuminated sculptures built from fluorescent fishing line, sound-reactive glowing fashion, and a projection-mapped "fallen star" sculpture are just a few examples of the light art we saw at Kinetica Art Fair 2013.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Design Your Own Clothes with Continuum Fashion
episodes.description: Continuum Fashion is a label that allows people to create their own designs using the hive mind of the internet as well as apps. It's one of those crowdsource-y, DIY companies that people learn about and then say, "The future is now!" So, uh, looks like the future is now, folks.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Animal Collective's 'Applesauce' (Live from Terminal 5)
episodes.description: Abby Portner, who dubs herself the “visual person” for Animal Collective, has been creating images to go with their sounds since they started their sonic experiments back in 2000. For the new album cover and tour poster she thought up the concept of an alien radio transmission…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Purity Ring Live
episodes.description: Purity Ring's light cocoons react uniquely to each performance. We spoke to the electronic duo after a recent Webster Hall show about the technology and inspiration behind their setup.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Meet OKFocus
episodes.description: OKFocus, the creative design agency that counts artists Ryder Ripps, Jonathan Vingiano, and Jules Laplace as its members, likes to take the path less trodden when it comes to website design. This is newly reinforced in their latest project, an alpha-channel video experiment for t…
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Aphex Twin's Remote Orchestra
episodes.description: One of electronic music's most lauded entities unveils his three-part performance piece, exploring a bold new direction in sound.
episodes.author: The Creators Project

episodes.title: Elephant Land!
episodes.description: The latest video from VICE Japan is about a wacky Busch Gardens-style amusement park in Chiba Prefecture. It's owned by a happy rich lady who swings from her elephants' trunks all day and smiles a lot.
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Capybara Bathhouse!
episodes.description: The capybara at Nagasaki Bio Park in Japan love to take dips in the park's hot springs. The park allows visitors to get up close with the animals, so we tried our best to make friends with these shy little beasts.
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Wiener Dog Races!
episodes.description: With their tiny legs, you'd think wiener dogs (or dachshunds, if you're a fancy lad) would be slow. NOT TRUE. These little ankle-nibblers can probably run faster than you and your lazy dog put together.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Surfing Dogs!
episodes.description: We all love dogs. But here at 'The Cute Show,' we REALLY love dogs. When you add in the fact that these dogs can surf... well, our cold little VICE hearts just about broke during this shoot. So please enjoy one of the most talent-filled episodes of the 'Really-Fucking-Cute Show,'…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Nigerian Pygmy Goats!
episodes.description: When we heard that our pal's family farm had just acquired three baby pygmy goats (easily one of the top ten cutest animals of all time), we set out to meet them ASAP. We contemplated stealing one, but that would be wrong, so we filmed our experience instead. Enjoy!

episodes.title: Sugar Gliders!
episodes.description: This might be the cutest Cute Show yet. We would literally punt a baby out the window if it was standing between us and these cuddly little guys.
episodes.author: Annette Lamothe-Ramos

episodes.title: Burrolandia!
episodes.description: A haven for cute and cuddly donkeys.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Dog Circus!
episodes.description: Can your pup jump rope? If not, don't feel bad. These are are special dogs who playfully show off their tricks at a Japanese dog circus.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Prague Ratters!
episodes.description: These tiny pups were once used to catch rats, but these days they're too busy being adorable to worry about that.

episodes.title: Neapolitan Mastiffs!
episodes.description: Neapolitan Mastiffs are a rare purebred that originated near Naples and descend directly from the Tibetan Mastiff, the king of all the mastiff dogs.

episodes.title: Lovely Owls!
episodes.description: Meet Molla. She is an Internet star and her name means 'spring' in Italian. She got it because she likes to jump up and down a lot.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Puggles!
episodes.description: Who knew that baby platypuses would be so cute?
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Pet Kingdom!
episodes.description: Welcome to the Pet Kingdom! Just watch out for a capuchin monkey named Ella; she likes to check folks' pockets for goodies.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Boar Piglets!
episodes.description: When VICE Germany sent us some footage of the Lehnitz animal asylum, we weren't sure how cute it was going to be. Little did we know, boar piglets live there!

episodes.title: Jumping Bunnies!
episodes.description: Bunny rabbits are adorable enough when they’re just sitting there twitching their pink noses or lapping water up from their little bottles, but when they’re hopping over brightly colored fences like tiny, long-eared horses while their super-enthusiastic trainers cheer from the si…

episodes.title: Baby Camels!
episodes.description: We admit, we’re not huge fans of camels. At first glance, they look like disabled, lumpy horses (and horses are quite frightening to begin with, unless they’re miniature).

episodes.title: Guinea Pig Village!
episodes.description: Guinea pigs are chubby-faced mega-hamsters that squeak when you squeeze them. Curiously, the animals do not originate from any country with "Guinea" in its name, nor are they a member of the pig family. They were domesticated when 16th-century explorers brought them from the Amer…

episodes.title: Baby Wombat Orphans!
episodes.description: We asked our associate editor Harry what he thought about wombats, and he said, "An ugly animal--like a bat but dumber." Then we showed him this video and he was paralyzed in an alternating laugh/awwww/laugh/awwww stupor for three whole minutes.

episodes.title: Dog Grooming Expo!
episodes.description: A bunch of dog lovers recently congregated at a convention center in Hershey, Pennsylvania, and groomed their pets to resemble everything except canines. We saw a dinosaur, that orange falcon thing from Harry Potter, Rainbow Brite, Eeyore from Winnie the Pooh, and even a hippie.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Red Squirrel Orphans!
episodes.description: Hurricane Katrina knocked over the wee home of some precious baby red squirrels. Luckily, the orphans were quickly relocated and now live with their foster mother, Eileen Welsh, in Morpeth, England. We stopped by Eileen's house at feeding time to make some furry new friends.
episodes.author: The Cute Show

episodes.title: Snow Leopard Cubs!
episodes.description: There's nothing better than watching newborn animals curiously explore the world around them. How can your eyes not be glued to all the digging, pouncing, sniffing, falling, and those wide eyes that are too big for their heads. So you can only imagine what it was like when we mad…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Baby Badgers!
episodes.description: Meet a couple of sweet and mischievous baby badgers at the Secret World Rehabilitation Wildlife Centre in the English countryside for jam sandwiches and bottled milk.

episodes.title: Peruvian Hairless Dogs!
episodes.description: Just like other breeds, hairless puppies look 100 percent adorable when they do anything.
episodes.author: Ellis Jones

episodes.title: Pygmy Shetland Ponies!
episodes.description: In this pint size version of the Cute Show, we traveled to Misty Meadow Farm to play with cutest and tiniest ponies around!
episodes.author: Ellis Jones

episodes.title: Red Pandas!
episodes.description: For this very furry episode of The Cute Show, we travelled all the way to China to fawn over one of the top ten cutest (and laziest) creatures on the planet: red pandas!

episodes.title: Potbellied Pigs!
episodes.description: For this episode, we hightailed it over to Ross Mill Farm and Piggy Camp, home of the pot potbellied pig.

episodes.title: Sloths!
episodes.description: Let’s meet Costa Rica’s cutest sloth babies!
episodes.author: Lucy Cooke

episodes.title: Homespun Merry-Go-Round!
episodes.description: Come ride on a merry-go-round with soul (and animatronic monkeys)!

episodes.title: Alpacas!
episodes.description: The Cute Show befriends a herd of peace-loving alpacas.

episodes.title: Lion Cubs!
episodes.description: The South Korean Home for Baby Animals has got themselves a set of lion cubs that are about as ad-orable as they come. At least for the next four or five months.

episodes.title: Season 2 - Jakwob
episodes.description: 23 year old dubstep DJ and producer, Jakwob, steps up to bat for the last episode in the series.

episodes.title: Season 2 - Jakwob Teaser
episodes.description: 23 year old dubstep DJ and producer, Jakwob, steps up to bat for the last episode in the series.

episodes.title: Season 2 - Starsmith Teaser
episodes.description: Starsmith's talents have been enlisted by the likes of Cheryl Cole and Kylie Minogue.
episodes.author: The Producers

episodes.description: Mike and Rob hit the studio to work on tracks for the D.O.T's imminent debut album.

episodes.description: Mike and Rob hit the studio to work on tracks for the D.O.T's imminent debut album.

episodes.author: The Producers

episodes.title: Season 2 - The Bullitts
episodes.description: The Bullitts, aka Jeymes Samuel, is the subject of episode two.   As a producer, a singer-song-writer and a filmmaker, creativity is never far from anything Samuel puts his hand to.  Currently working with a host of impressive names for his debut album, most notably Hollywood act…

episodes.title: Season 2 - Benga
episodes.description: The second seaon of The Producers kicks off with South London dubstep pioneer Benga. episodes.description: The Producers returns for a second series. Six films, showcasing the unique creative process of six of the world's most exciting producers, direct from the Red Bull Studios London.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Season 1 - Andrew Wyatt

episodes.description: Duffy explains the etymological differences between whinos and Huaynos.

episodes.description: Duffy talks about the men and women who make it their responsibility to patrol the Mexican-American border armed only with their machine guns and patriotism.

episodes.description: Thomas fills us in on the bizarre training Indian phone operators undergo and his own intense dislike of a certain network sitcom.

episodes.description: Duffy explains how he showed up at Korean boy band’s studio looking like a heroin addict.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to The VICE Guide to Everything - Narco Cinema
episodes.description: Of all the violent, poor, disease-ridden places Shane has visited over the years, he still insists that Mexico is the most dangerous.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to The VICE Guide to Everything - Sewers of Bogota
episodes.description: Thomas and Shane talk about the mental hangover involved in visiting places like the sewers of Bogota and their methods for shaking the depression.

episodes.description: The Business of War is a formal place, where billionaire weapons producers attend conventions to pitch their deadly products.

episodes.description: People are always asking Shane what it takes to get in the mag: voodoo + cyber crime + sex = winner, A.K.A. Sakawa Boys.

episodes.description: Take a wild guess at which episode was Duffy’s mom’s least favorite. Correct! The one where her son gets shot.

episodes.description: Did Thomas “Baby Balls” Morton really steal that car in Ramallah Street Racing?

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to The VICE Guide to Everything - Afghan Training Village
episodes.description: Shane mocks Duffy for going all Hollywood on the Afghan training village.

episodes.description: The gang remembers Jay Thunderbolt’s trip to New York and his role as the big-talking, knife wielding, lady killer of Detroit.

episodes.description: Ryan Duffy recalls how close he came to sleeping with the fishes when he visited the Russian mob boss, Vitaly Dyomochka.

episodes.description: Shane explains how he and Spike Jonze escaped arrest in Yemen.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to Everything: Trailer
episodes.description: Exposing the absurdity of the modern condition.The Vice Guide to Everything Airs 11PM / 10PM C.

episodes.description: This particular episode of Vice Guide to Film focuses on Palestinian refugees and their burgeoning film scene.

Khitan, or circumcision, is a tradition upheld by Islamic law; often a public event, it is a celebrated and widely practiced Musli…

episodes.description: The Watermelon Woman has an ass that we are literally unable to describe.

The only things that come from his mouth are raucous stories of his sexual conquests, and the loudest, most infectious laugh you've ever heard. As we arrive in Florida, he shows us through his collection of homemade porn and explains how the l…

episodes.description: They sure do love their burros in Colombia.

episodes.description: Oscar Maroni is the publisher of Brazilian Hustler and Penthouse, the putter-on of Brazil’s top ultimate fighting show, and a budding local politician.

episodes.description: Icelanders have been doing elves in secret for centuries, but the subject’s strictly verboten for outsiders. Thanks to Hallgerdur, we’re breaking the silence.

episodes.title: Imbalu: Circumcision Party
episodes.description: We take a look at Imbalu, the (sort of) ancient Ugandan practice of mass teenage circumcision.

episodes.description: His name is Shigeo Tokuda and he is a 74-year-old porn performer.

episodes.description: Daikichi’s Genki-Genki production house is pushing pornography into insane, way offbeat places.

episodes.description: Casa Xochiquetzal: Mexico's elderly sex farm.

episodes.description: Yasuyuki takes us to Tokyo’s shittiest doll brothel.

episodes.title: The Japanese Love Industry
episodes.description: In these difficult times, many Japanese are putting marriage and families on the back burner and seeking recreational love and affection as a cheap escape. We sent Ryan Duffy to investigate Tokyo's cuddle cafes and Yakuza-sponsored prostitution.
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: Human Safari
episodes.description: Tourists on India's Andaman Islands are taken by the busload to watch the Jarawa tribe go about their daily lives. The Jarawa are treated like animals in a safari park, with large signs urging visitors not to feed them or give them clothing.
episodes.author: VICE Germany

episodes.title: Blood Sacrifice in Sumba
episodes.description: Sumba is an island in the Indonesian archipelago that has been cut off from the rest of the world for so long that its ancient traditions survive to this day. It is the setting for annual ritual battles called Pasola in February and March. The Pasola is a fight between rival clan…

episodes.title: Blood Sacrifice in Sumba - Trailer
episodes.description: Sumba is an island the size of Jamaica in the Indonesian archipelago that has been cut off from the rest of the world for so long that its ancient animistic traditions survive to this day. It is the setting for ritual battles called Pasola which take place every year in February
episodes.author: Milene Larsson

episodes.title: The Tiny VICE Guide to Doha
episodes.description: We tried to find the best shawarma in Doha but ended up searching for robot camel jockeys (apparently this is a real thing) and drinking in very strange bars.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to Karachi
episodes.description: VICE founder Suroosh Alvi visits Pakistan's ultraviolent metropolis.
episodes.author: Suroosh Alvi

episodes.title: Takanakuy
episodes.description: Takanakuy is a fighting ceremony with roots in the Andes’s pre–Spanish, pre–Incan history. In the absence of pretty much any form of justice system—the Chumbivilcas state police department sports a whopping three officers—villagers and townspeople from the region save up their gr…

episodes.title: The Warias
episodes.description: Indonesia's Muslim transvestites need a place to pray, too.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to the Balkans
episodes.description: To commemorate 12 years without a major attempted genocide in the Balkans, we decided to rent a Yugo and take a road trip through the remnants of old Yugoslavia.

episodes.title: Jesus of Siberia
episodes.description: Vissarion's church of the last testament is the only reason to visit Siberia.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: Kabul Trailer
episodes.description: VICE co-founder Suroosh Alvi travels to Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan, accompanied by photographer Ariana Delawari. Together they witness the vicious impact left by the Taliban regime.
episodes.author: Сурош Алви

episodes.description: The Santos Malandros (in English, the Holy Thugs) are an alternative set of saints whose common traits include sideways baseball hats, cigarettes, and guns.
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: Libyan Lockdown
episodes.description: Libya is the latest nation to experience the violent civil unrest that has plagued North Africa since December. But in August 2010 things were much different.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mongolian Yak Festival
episodes.description: VBS travels to the vast epic-ness of Khovsgol Province in northern Mongolia to check in on the second annual Yak Festival.

episodes.title: Prostitutes of God
episodes.description: VICE travels to the Indian city of Sangli to meet a group of bolshy sex workers selling their bodies in the name of the Hindu Goddess Yellamm.

episodes.title: Last Dinosaur of the CONGO
episodes.description: Legend has it that the last remaining dinosaur lives inside the Congolese jungle

episodes.title: Illegal Border Crossing Park
episodes.description: In El Alberto they offer tourists the chance to participate in a simulated illegal border crossing.

episodes.title: House of the Setting Sun
episodes.description: VICE travels to Casa Xochiquetzal, a residential facility in one of Mexico City's shadiest neighborhoods that caters exclusively to the area's elderly sex workers.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to Liberia
episodes.description: Heroin dens, teenage prostitution, cross-dressing cannibals... Welcome to the VICE Guide to Liberia. Things are about to get really hairy.
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Mecca Diaries
episodes.description: Last year Suroosh Alvi , VICE Founder, went with his family to Hajj in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. The world’s largest annual pilgrimage. He shot this footage with an old Handicam.

episodes.title: Wodka Wars
episodes.description: Vice Scandinavia correspondent Ivar Berglin travels to the front lines of the Vodka/Wodka Wars - and discovers that the tortured history of Russian-Polish relations can be saved in a bottle.
episodes.author: Ivar Berglin

episodes.title: Gorillas in the Midst
episodes.description: VBS travels to Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo where the endangered mountain gorillas - 200 of the Earth's last 720 — are in a desperate fight for their survival.

episodes.title: The VICE Guide to North Korea
episodes.description: VICE founder Shane Smith romps around the hermit kingdom.
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Nimbin Mardi Grass
episodes.description: Really, really, really stoned.

episodes.title: Jeepnys: The Rolling Carnival
episodes.description: Jeepnys are Filipino hotrods, and there’s no better way to get around Manila.

episodes.title: The Last Aryans of Paraguay
episodes.description: South America’s lost Aryan colony.

episodes.title: Gypsies of Sophia
episodes.description: VBS tours the fetid garbage dump Bulgaria’s Gypsies are forced to live in.

episodes.title: Filipino Feed Lot
episodes.description: Sampling some of Manila’s most questionable delicacies. First up: Soup No. 5.

episodes.description: Shane Smith hunts for mutant wolves in Chernobyl.

episodes.description: Having a gay old time in China’s capital of consumerism.

episodes.description: David Choe gallivants China in Season 3 of Thumbs Up!
