episodes.description: David and Harry begin their second great trek from Tijuana, plotting a course up the US and Canadian and again US West Coast to the North Pole.

episodes.title: Thumbs Up! Season 1
episodes.description: David Choe hitchhikes his way across these United States by (other people’s) trains, cars, and boats.

episodes.title: America's Water Crisis
episodes.description: Every time it rains in New York City, billions of gallons of raw sewage are piped directly into the Hudson River. Superstorms like Hurricane Sandy only magnify the issue by flooding New York's waterways. And the same basic infrastructure problem is facing over 700 American cities…
episodes.author: Emerson Rosenthal

episodes.title: Amazon
episodes.description: We went to investigate an environmental activist's murder in Marabé, Brazil, the front lines of the fight to preserve or plow under the Amazon Rainforest, and a town so lawless and violent the locals call it Marabála (that means Mara-bullets).
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: TOXIC: Amazon - Trailer
episodes.description: We went to investigate an environmental activist's murder in Marabé, Brazil, the front lines of the fight to preserve or plow under the Amazon Rainforest and a town so lawless and violent that the locals call it Marabála (that means Mara-bullets).
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: TOXIC: Gulf
episodes.description: As the rest of the world busts a gasket over dying pelicans, we sent Baby Balls down to Louisian-aye-ay to hang out with some humans whose lives just got smothered in oil.

episodes.title: TOXIC: West Virginia
episodes.description: VBS investigates mountain-top removal in Appalachia - and shows us what the end of the world looks like.

episodes.title: TOXIC: Imperial Valley
episodes.description: In the burning fields of Southern California's Imperial Valley, the honey bee population is dying, and so are millions of fish in the Salton Sea.

episodes.title: TOXIC: Napoli
episodes.description: In the city of Naples and the surrounding countryside of Campania, Italy, the Mafia has controlled the waste-management industry for decades.

episodes.title: TOXIC: Linfen, China
episodes.description: VBS travels to the single most polluted place on earth, the coal-mining town of Linfen in Shanxi Province, China, where kids play in dirty rivers and the sun sets early behind a thick curtain of smog.

episodes.title: TOXIC: Garbage Island
episodes.description: Come aboard as the VICE crew takes a cruise to the Northern Gyre in the Pacific Ocean, a spot where currents spin and cycle, churning up tons of plastic into a giant pool of chemical soup, flecked with bits and whole chunks of refuse that cannot biodegrade.

episodes.title: TOXIC: Alberta
episodes.description: Once pristine wilderness, Alberta is now a world of poisoned water, polluted air, and rare cancer travels to the oil sands of Canada to investigate the impact of digging for this previously unobtainable oil.

episodes.title: Las Vegas
episodes.description: Haulin’ Balls is owned by three friends who take the traditional meatball, re-imagine it, and serve it up in innovative ways. From the traditional Godfather to the unexpected Buffalo Chicken Balls, they can transform almost any cuisine into a ball, using fresh, locally sourced in…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Philadelphia
episodes.description: Philadelphia is filled with longstanding food traditions like the Philly cheesesteak. In this episode, Max and Eli check out Lil Dan's food truck to taste his twist on the cheesesteak. Inspired by this culinary classic, the brothers set out to find more uniquely Philly food custo…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Los Angeles
episodes.description: The luchador scene expanding rapidly through LA with fights popping up and a flood of new contenders entering the biz. Case and point, El Burger Luchador, the food truck that's a manifestation of the cult following these masked wrestlers have cultivated.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Nashville
episodes.description: As with most alluring American cities, the food truck scene in Nashville is going strong, and the SoulFuel 501 truck is among the best of a new breed of trucks bringing an innovative twist to classic southern cuisine.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Miami
episodes.description: Beloved food truck Mojo on the Go is the best of the best of “southern Florida cuisine”— a fusion of Creole-, Cuban-, and swamp-inspired food, including alligator, frog legs, and more. Located on the edge of the world famous Everglades National Park, the truck only offers swamp-c…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: New York
episodes.description: The Sussman brothers take the cutesy New York cupcake from the chic streets of Soho to a Brooklyn heavy metal bar. Can cupcakes tame the hearts of these hardcore rock n' rollers?
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Series Trailer
episodes.description: 'Truckers in the Wild' is a six-part series on VICE created in partnership with Hellmann’s. The show follows New York City chefs, brothers, and cookbook authors Max and Eli Sussman as they explore the food-truck phenomenon by finding the best food trucks in six vastly different c…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Undercity: Las Vegas
episodes.description: Undercity is a team comprised of two guys who enjoy crawling through cities' sewers and assorted shit-covered subterranean locales. We teamed up with director Andrew Wonder and Steve Duncan to create this film about Las Vegas' tunnel system.

episodes.title: Tokyo Rising
episodes.description: Excited to be back in Tokyo, Pharrell heads to Ambush Design where he reconnects with Verbal and Yoon as they recount their own experiences on 3/11.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Trailer: Tokyo Rising
episodes.description: While Japan reels from radiation scares and the reality of its continuing recovery, we travelled with Pharrell Williams to Tokyo, to check out how the artists and activists that drive the culture are dealing with their new reality.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Pirate Radio
episodes.description: Exploring London's original and current illegal underground radio scenes.

episodes.title: Detroit Lives
episodes.description: Johnny Knoxville and VBS spend time with the creative badasses quietly rebuilding Detroit.

episodes.title: Listen In: Berlin
episodes.description: Under the mythical bunkers of Berlin, we check to see the remnants left behind.

episodes.title: Listen In: Berlin - Trailer
episodes.description: We’re putting our boots on and climbing through this city’s spy labyrinths and into the buildings that housed the hidden world of military espionage.

episodes.title: Missle Silo Homes
episodes.description: In the 1960s, the US government built missile silos across the country to protect citizens against nuclear attack. Decommissioned years later, they now serve as shelters to the reclusive and gathering places to the adventurous. We went exploring.

episodes.title: The Ruins of New York
episodes.description: New York City is brimming with abandoned, hidden and forgotten spaces. Besides a select group of men who make their hidden living discovering their hidden value, few people are aware these places exist. We went exploring.

episodes.title: Solar Plane
episodes.description: If we trust Bertrand Piccard's Solar Impulse, soon we'll be flying around the world in airplanes powered by the Sun.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Robo Fish
episodes.description: How can we monitor the world's oceans effectively and cheaply? With robotic fish.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mushroom Plastics
episodes.description: Edan Bayer takes us on a trip through his mushroom factory.
episodes.author: Brian Anderson

episodes.title: The Living House
episodes.description: Imagine a future where the cities we live in are built in accordance with nature, where buildings are designed to incorporate features from ecological systems without compromising technological innovation or the quality of the environment. If it sounds like wishful thinking - or
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Weather Lasers
episodes.description: World water use is rising faster than our world population. The tiny island nation of Tuvalu has been crippled by drought and may be just the first island nation to run dry. Texas has been hit by massive dust storms thanks to that state's record drought. That's just a drop in the…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Sailing Drone
episodes.description: After visiting the Deepwater Horizon oil spill in June of 2010, a young engineer decided to develop an open source oil spill cleaning robot, Protei.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Upgrade Series Trailer
episodes.description: Higher tech for humankind.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: 'Bad Grandpa' - Behind the Scenes
episodes.description: We sent a crew to hang out with Johnny Knoxville and co. to see how they went about bamboozeling the general public while filming Bad Grandpa. They came back with some great footage and bruised scrotums—that little kid actor is a real firecracker.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: 'Escape from Tomorrow' - Behind the Scenes
episodes.description: A dark fantasy shot in secret at Disneyworld and Disneyland, Escape from Tomorrow explores the corporatization of domestic bliss as one man's family vacation to Disneyworld goes... well, "awry" would be an understatement.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Slavoj Zizek
episodes.description: The "most dangerous philosopher in the West" talks about his new film and lectures us on the importance of being on time. If you're curious about that poster of Stalin on his wall, it's "purely to annoy idiots" when they visit.
episodes.author: Alex Miller

episodes.title: Clive Stafford Smith
episodes.description: Clive Stafford Smith spent years working as a death-row lawyer in the South before becoming the legal director of the UK branch of Reprieve, a non-profit organization that has long campaigned for the rights of death-row prisoners. Since 2002 Reprieve has helped release prisoners
episodes.author: Alex Miller

episodes.title: Conrad Black
episodes.description: Conrad Black is a controversial former media baron who renounced his Canadian citizenship to become a British Lord, and later spent time in an American jail for fraud. We went to his sprawling estate in Toronto's luxurious Bridal Path neighborhood to chat with him about how the U…
episodes.author: VICE Canada

episodes.title: Sue Johanson
episodes.description: In part one of our three-part interview with Sue Johanson of 'Sunday Night Sex Show' fame, Kara Crabb chats with Sue about her origins as a nurse, being a pioneer of sexual education in a time when abortion was illegal, and the priests who told her to poke holes in condoms.
episodes.author: Kara Crabb

episodes.title: Sue Johanson - Teaser
episodes.description: Sue Johanson from Canada's 'Sunday Night Sex Show' sat down with our very own Kara Crabb for a long chat about menopause, how to put on a condom with your mouth, butt sex, vaginal sex, dicks, and balls. Here's the teaser.
episodes.author: Kara Crabb

episodes.title: David LaChapelle
episodes.description: Photographer David LaChapelle invites us into his LA studio and reminisces about his early days in New York, back when he used to work at Studio 54, hang out at the Mudd Club, and generally be a fabulous young man.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Susan Miller
episodes.description: World-renowned astrologer Susan Miller hangs out with VICE's Thalia Mavros and invites us into her Astrology Zone (.com). If you watch it to the very end, she'll tell you exactly how and when you will die.
episodes.author: Thalia Mavros

episodes.title: Rob Corddry (Again)
episodes.description: Last year, we got drunk with Rob and had such a good time, we wanted to hang out with him again. So VICE's Thobey Campion met up with the 'Children's Hospital' star at a record store where they talked about all sorts of good stuff. Enjoy!
episodes.author: Thobey Campion

episodes.title: André Saraiva
episodes.description: You may know André Saraiva as the man behind the club empire Le Baron, but in this episode of 'VICE Meets' we talk about how he got involved in graffiti and his installation at The Hole Gallery in New York. The show was worth a visit, and we should really look into getting that l…
episodes.author: Cleo Le-Tan

episodes.title: Karen Black
episodes.description: We were excited when Karen invited us to her home in LA for tea and a nice long chat about the art of acting, why she regrets starring in horror films, and her recent musical collaborations with Cass McCombs.
episodes.author: Jason Mojica

episodes.title: Guy Tavares
episodes.description: Guy Tavares is a cult legend from The Hague who founded the legendary electro label Bunker Records. He also plays in the stoner-rock band Santa Cruz and runs the nightmarish club Dystopia. For this episode of 'VICE Meets' we visited Guy's squat and discussed his deranged ideology…
episodes.author: Jens van Dongen

episodes.title: Terence Winter
episodes.description: If you find yourself playing Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon and you want to connect Tia or Tamera Mowry to Steve Buscemi, you could use 'Boardwalk Empire' creator Terence Winter, who used to write for 'Sister, Sister.'
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Robert Baer
episodes.description: We met former CIA man Robert Baer in a shady motel room in Newport Beach, California, to discuss the difference between the life of a real-life spy and the crap you see in the movies.
episodes.author: Jason Mojica

episodes.title: Andrew Richardson
episodes.description: In the sexiest episode of VICE Meets ever, we interview stylist and Editor-in-Chief of Richardson Magazine, Andrew Richardson.
episodes.author: Cleo Le-Tan

episodes.title: Ben Anderson
episodes.description: Television reporter Ben Anderson spent over five years embedded with British and American troops in Afghanistan.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Larry Flynt
episodes.description: Political writer Reihan Salam interviews Hustler publisher and controversial free speech advocate Larry Flynt in this very special episode of VICE Meets.
episodes.author: Reihan Salam

episodes.title: Winston Smith
episodes.description: We sipped a few beers and reminisced with legendary punk artist and creator of the Dead Kennedys logo, Winston Smith.
episodes.author: Thobey Campion

episodes.title: Johnny Ryan
episodes.description: Johnny Ryan has been filling the back page of VICE magazine with twisted comics for the past ten years.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: Rob Delaney
episodes.description: While in LA working on our Showbiz issue, we met up with comedian and VICE columnist Rob Delaney for a chat about hairiness, Twitter, and funny meat words.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: Kenneth Anger
episodes.description: Did I annoy the 85-year-old filmmaker and writer enough for him to cast a Thelemic curse on me?

episodes.title: Cees Hendriks
episodes.description: After making millions by smuggling weed from his Moroccan plantation to the rest of the world, and being captured and convicted for the seventh time, Cees Hendriks decided to change his life and focus on refining cannabis seeds. Now he's revolutionizing weed growth.

episodes.title: Abel Ferrara
episodes.description: In this episode of VICE Meets, we meet cult independent filmmaker Abel Ferrara in his neighborhood, Little Italy. He explains the true story behind his original series for VICE, Pizza Connection, together with a former FBI agent who joins us amidst neighborhood commotion.

episodes.title: agnès b.
episodes.description: agnès b. is a french designer, film director, producer, and patron of the performing arts. She is also the main supporter of the scientific vessel Tara, which investigates the impact of global warming.

episodes.title: Pricasso
episodes.description: We recently spent the afternoon in Australia's Gold Coast hinterland with Tim Patch, aka Pricasso, a trailblazing artist who paints with his dick. He also uses his balls.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Father Amorth
episodes.description: Besides having authored ten books on faith and exorcism which have been translated into ten languages, and being the honorary president and founder of the International Association of Exorcists, and hosting an Italian radio show called An Exorcist Speaks on Radio Maria, 87-year-o…

episodes.title: Delfín Quishpe
episodes.description: Delfín Quishpe is an Ecuadorian techno-folk star who became a YouTube sensation with his 2007 music video “Torres Gemelas” (Twin Towers). He also wrote a song about the trapped Chilean miners and often wears custom-made pants that have DELFIN stitched on both leg…

episodes.title: DFC
episodes.description: From stylish lab equipment to decorative unicorns, there's no limit to DFC's designs. DFC's founders, Mauricio and Tony, arrived in Mexico to discover and be inspired by a world of color and a long-withstanding culture. We met with them to find out more about their lives, their w…

episodes.title: Jon Glaser
episodes.description: Jon Glaser, the creator and star of Adult Swim's Delocated, is hilarious. We threw back a few beers with him while talking about his comedy career and how cool it'd be to get a tattoo of a bird who likes to party. Then we walked to a nearby tattoo parlor and our host Thobey got a…

episodes.title: Paul Jenkins
episodes.description: VICE travels to Atlanta to sit down with comic book writer and video game creator Paul Jenkins.  We find out about the his past work on such projects as Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Spider-Man as well as his involvement in the most recent Darkness 2 game. Paul has risen in th…

episodes.title: Tatiana Bilbao
episodes.description: Tatiana Bilbao has been fascinated by space and her surroundings since childhood. She's since grown into one of Mexico's most relevant architects, and she enjoys global recognition. Her projects have included a botanical garden in Mexico and an ambitious exhibition room in China

episodes.title: Heavy metal v Bagdádu
episodes.description: Hrát heavy metal v muslimské zemi bylo vždy složité, ale po Husajnově pádu nastal krátký okamžik, v němž byla skutečná svoboda možná.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Talking to Ghost About the Beach Boys
episodes.description: A nameless ghoul from the Swedish metal band Ghost sat down with us to talk about Satan's faith in his band and his band's faith in the Beach Boys.

episodes.title: Curren$y ft. Daz Dillinger - "Fast Cars Faster Women"
episodes.description: New Orleans' Curren$y is gearing up to launch his debut commercial LP, The Stoned Immaculate, on June 5.
episodes.author: NOISEY Staff

episodes.title: Sebastien Tellier's Extremely NSFW Video for "Cochon Ville"
episodes.description: A bacchanal orgy in which Tellier, dressed in ceremonial robes and grinning like a madman, oversees a bunch of nubile French babes.

episodes.title: The Odd Future Pop Up Store
episodes.description: Before a sold-out OFWGKTA show at Hammerstein Ballroom, we went down to the Lower East Side to check out the new Odd Future pop-up shop, where they sling self-described "ugly, tacky shit."

episodes.title: Do Cute Kids Love Indie Rock?
episodes.description: We asked some cute cuddly little tykes to review the Cribs' new single, "Chi Town,"  in hopes of answering that age old question: do little kids like indie rock? They didn't pull any punches.

episodes.title: Syd Tha Kyd Gets More Ass Than Anyone in Odd Future
episodes.description: Filmmaker Lance Bangs cruised to Venice Beach to chill with Syd Tha Kyd and found girls pouring out of her room. In this video, Syd opens up about her MC kid-brother Taco and how she met Tyler.

episodes.title: Scion A/V Presents Black Lips - New Direction
episodes.description: Black Lips have premiered the third video directed by our very own Jake Burghart from their latest album Arabia Mountain.

episodes.title: GONZOWORLD TV: Bang On! - 'Got It' Official Music Video (VBS)
episodes.description: Bang On!‘s as funny as he is furious. And here’s proof: the video for his new single “Got It”, produced by up-and-coming director Jamie Roberts. (And us. We helped out, along with K-Swiss, and will be doing more of the same with other young artists,

episodes.title: Black Lips Video Premiere of 'Modern Art'
episodes.description: Black Lips just dropped a new video for “Modern Art” — it’s the first taste of their collaboration with Mark Ronson.

episodes.title: Heavy Metal in Baghdad
episodes.description: Heavy Metal in Baghdad is a feature film documentary that follows the Iraqi heavy metal band Acrassicauda from the fall of Saddam Hussein in 2003 to the present day. Playing heavy metal in a Muslim country has always been a difficult (if not impossible) proposition but after Sadd…

episodes.title: Win Win - Interleave (Feat. Alexis Taylor) Music Video
episodes.description: Check it out, it’s the premiere music video for Win Win.

episodes.title: Bonnie 'Prince' Billy
episodes.description: This is one of my favorite live performances I’ve filmed; Bonnie ‘Prince’ Billy walking out onto a minor league baseball park in Coney Island in the summer of 2003.

episodes.title: Black Lips Video Premiere of "Go Out and Get It!"
episodes.description: Man, what a drag. We had to go all the way to the fucking Bahamas this weekend to make a video for The Black Lips.

episodes.title: Ryan Z
episodes.description: Sporting flamingo neck tattoos and flowing blonde hair, Ryan lives to make music, drink vast amounts of SoCo and remain true to his Spicoli-like nature.

episodes.title: Ink & Dagger
episodes.description: After 11 years, the remaining members of Ink & Dagger’s original line up, along with new frontman Geoff Rickly, play their very first show at Party Expo in Brooklyn.

episodes.title: New Garage Explosion
episodes.description: We travel to Memphis to mind-meld with Magic Kids and to go head-to-head with Jay Reatard in the last interview he filmed before his death.

episodes.title: OFF! - Behind The Scenes:  Darkness
episodes.description: The second video from OFF!  is for their track “Darkness.”

episodes.title: OFF! - Behind The Scenes: Black Thoughts
episodes.description: “Black Thoughts,” the third video released from OFF!, includes a cameo by Raymond Pettibon, the painter responsible for penning all of the band’s album artwork.

episodes.title: OFF! - Behind The Scenes: I Don't Belong
episodes.description: The fourth and final video from OFF!‘s First EP is the 60 second song, “I Don’t Belong,” and stars actual denizens of LA vocalizing the song’s countercultural lyrics.

episodes.title: Cheeseburger @ The Bell House
episodes.description: Brooklyn’s own Cheeseburger play the Bell House.

episodes.title: Uncontrollable Women
episodes.description: Lance Bangs gets down with the Uncontrollable Women Bike club in Dayton, Ohio.

episodes.title: Acrassicauda's Garden of Stones Music Video
episodes.description: Acrassicauda’s first ever music video.

episodes.title: Acrassicauda: Our Long Story, Short
episodes.description: The story of Acrassicauda from Heavy Metal in Baghdad to their arrival in the US.

episodes.title: Heavy Metal in Baghdad:Trailer
episodes.description: The trailer for Heavy Metal in Baghdad, a feature film documentary that follows the Iraqi heavy metal band Acrassicauda from the fall of Saddam Hussein in 2003 to the present day.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Acrassicauda: DVD Extra: Heavy Metal in Istanbul
episodes.description: After the completion of Heavy Metal in Baghdad, Acrassicauda fled to Damascus, Syria for Istanbul, Turkey.

episodes.title: Acrassicauda: DVD Extra: A Brief History of Acrassicauda
episodes.description: Baghdad, August 2006

episodes.title: Acrassicauda: DVD Extra: Mike, Our Buddy in Damascus
episodes.description: Damascus, December 2006

episodes.title: British Nationals Fight with al Qaeda in Syria
episodes.description: Yesterday, the Director-General of the UK’s intelligence service MI5 announced that hundreds of British Muslims have traveled to Syria to take part in "terrorist tourism." Here is exclusive video footage and interviews with the British nationals fighting with al Qaeda.
episodes.author: Medyan Dairieh

episodes.title: Black, White & Greek
episodes.description: After two University of Alabama sororities rejected an African American student because of her race, an anti-racist student group took action to prevent segregation within the university's Greek system. We went down to Tuscaloosa to see how this shit is still happening in 2013.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Ghost Rapes of Bolivia
episodes.description: For a while, the residents of Manitoba Colony thought demons were raping the town’s women. There was no other explanation. No way of explaining how a woman could wake up with blood and semen stains smeared across her sheets and no memory of the previous night.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Ghost Rapes of Bolivia - Trailer
episodes.description: For a while, the residents of Manitoba Colony thought demons were raping the town’s women. There was no other explanation. No way of explaining how a woman could wake up with blood and semen stains smeared across her sheets and no memory of the previous night.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The São Paulo Protests in 7 Acts
episodes.description: The Free Pass Movement started in October 2012, and by June 2013 it had become a large-scale protest group fighting to lower the cost of transportation in São Paulo. This documentary tells their victorious story and features on-the-ground rubber-bullet-laden riot footage.
episodes.author: VICE Brazil

episodes.title: Burning Men of Bulgaria
episodes.description: In the past six months, Bulgaria has experienced a wave of self-immolations. During one span in February and March alone, six Bulgarians killed themselves with fire, and at least ten people in total have done so in the past six months.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Chemical Valley
episodes.description: Forty percent of Canada's petrochemical industry is packed into a 15-square-mile area in Sarnia, Ontario, called the Chemical Valley. More than 60 chemical plants and oil refineries operate there 24/7. As a result of the Chemical Valley's emissions, in 2011 the World Health Organ…
episodes.author: Patrick McGuire

episodes.title: Julian Assange Talks to VICE About Bradley Manning and Political Payback
episodes.description: VICE was invited to the Ecuadorian embassy in London for a rare in-person interview with Julian Assange. Our visit coincided with the conviction of Bradley Manning…
episodes.author: Royce Akers

episodes.title: Julian Assange Talks to VICE About Bradley Manning and Political Payback - Trailer
episodes.description: VICE was invited to the Ecuadorian embassy in London for a rare in-person interview with Julian Assange. Our visit coincided with the conviction of Bradley Manning…
episodes.author: Royce Akers

episodes.title: Israel's Killer Robots
episodes.description: Israel is the world's biggest exporter of military drones, used around the world for everything from surveillance to precision rocket attacks on speeding cars in remote locales. Israel's drone program hasn't stirred as much controversy as its American counterpart, but not because…
episodes.author: Simon Ostrovsky

episodes.title: Egypt After Morsi with Gigi Ibrahim
episodes.description: The battles in the streets of Egypt have left so many dead and wounded—families are having trouble claiming and burying their loved ones. To get an understanding on what is happening in Cairo, VICE linked up with activist Gigi Ibrahim for a grand tour of the chaos.
episodes.author: Gigi Ibrahim

episodes.title: Fake Funerals in South Korea
episodes.description:
South Korea is the suicide capital of the developed world, with an average of 43 suicides per day. 
Unsurprisingly, this has provoked much soul-searching within South Korea, resulting in the "Well Dying"—or "Near Death"—movement and "fake funeral" services, which aim to give peo…
episodes.author: VICE Japan

episodes.title: Egypt After Morsi
episodes.description: On June 30, exactly one year after Egyptians voted for Mohammed Morsi to become their first-ever democratically elected president, millions of protesters filled central Cairo and town squares across Egypt demanding his dismissal. Was this another Egyptian revolution, a military c…
episodes.author: Aris Roussinos

episodes.title: Colombia's Hidden Killers
episodes.description: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, was founded 50 years ago as a Marxist army fighting against capitalist imperialism and Colombia’s often-brutal government. In recent years, FARC has devolved into a guerrilla force that threatens the very people it originally s…
episodes.author: Krishna Andavolu

episodes.title: Colombia's Hidden Killers - Trailer
episodes.description: The Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, was founded five decades ago years ago as a Marxist people’s army fighting against capitalist imperialism and Colombia’s often-brutal government. In order to secure their dwindling territory and lucrative coca fields, FARC has…
episodes.author: Krishna Andavolu

episodes.title: Egypt After Morsi - Trailer
episodes.description: Some are calling it a military coup, others are insisting it's a people's revolution. What's for sure is that on Wednesday, July 3rd, a year of turmoil and discontent in Egypt climaxed in the deposition of president Mohamed Morsi. But what lies ahead for an Egypt that remains pol…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Battle of Consolação
episodes.description: Since June 2, when the price of public transportation in São Paulo, Brazil, rose from R$3 to R$3.20, the Free Pass Movement has initiated protests that have turned into a revolt. On June 13, protesters who had been marching peacefully from the Municipal Theater to Avenida Paulist…
episodes.author: VICE Brazil

episodes.title: The Battle of Taksim Square
episodes.description: This footage was shot by Robert King last Tuesday morning when Taksim Square was being evicted by the riot police. The Turkish prime minister, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, had said he would meet with the protesters on Wednesday, but then, all of a sudden, the police entered Taksim Tuesd…
episodes.author: Robert King

episodes.title: Femen - Sextremism in Paris
episodes.description: The topless protest group Femen started out in the Ukraine in 2008. Today, it's a global movement with more than 300 topless warriors. Their fans say they are courageous, no-nonsense activists, while their critics say their tactics devalue the fight for female equality. To find o…
episodes.author: Milene Larsson

episodes.title: Istanbul Rising
episodes.description: On Friday, May 31, Turkish riot police fired tear gas and pepper spray into a peaceful protest held to save Gezi Park, one of the last green areas in central Istanbul. This set off the biggest civil uprising in the history of the Turkish Republic, calling for Prime Minister Erdog…
episodes.author: Milene Larsson

episodes.title: White Student Union
episodes.description: We recently went to Towson University to speak with Matthew Heimbach, the founder of a group that advocates for “persons of European heritage." We also met the students who want him off campus... or at least muzzled. 'White Student Union' is a documentary about race, class, and s…
episodes.author: Wes Enzinna

episodes.title: Triple Hate
episodes.description: 'Triple Hate' is a four-part documentary about Nathan Bedford Forrest, the Memphis City Council, the Klan, the Crips, Ulysses S. Grant, racism, and the specter of history. It will be airing every day this week, only on VICE.com.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

We also met the students who want him off campus... or at least muzzled. 'White Student Union' is a documentary about race, class, and s…

episodes.title: Sisa: Cocaine of the Poor
episodes.description: A new drug called sisa is tearing its way through Athens' poor. The ingredients are basically meth and filler things like battery acid, engine oil, shampoo, and cooking salt. It acts faster and the effects last longer than coke, and it can be produced in home-based laboratories.
episodes.author: Alex Miller

episodes.title: Triple Hate - Trailer
episodes.description: 'Triple Hate' is a documentary about Nathan Bedford Forrest, the Memphis City Council, the Klan, the Crips, Ulysses S. Grant, racism, and the specter of history. Part one premieres Tuesday, May 21, on VICE.com.
episodes.author: Rocco Castoro

episodes.title: This Is What Winning Looks Like
episodes.description: Filmmaker and author Ben Anderson went to Afghanistan in 2007 and stayed for six years. 'This Is What Winning Looks Like' is his disturbing documentary about the ineptitude, drug abuse, sexual misconduct, and corruption of the Afghan security forces and the role of US Marines dur…

episodes.title: This Is What Winning Looks Like - Trailer
episodes.description: Filmmaker and author Ben Anderson went to Afghanistan in 2007 and stayed for six years. 'This Is What Winning Looks Like' is his disturbing new documentary about the ineptitude, drug abuse, sexual misconduct, and corruption of the Afghan security forces and the role of US Marines…
episodes.author: Ben Anderson

episodes.title: Bomb Blast Bajaur
episodes.description: On April 20, a female suicide bomber attacked a hospital in Khar, one of the largest towns in Pakistan's Bajaur region. Four people were killed. When we visited Bajaur six months earlier, the army had recently eradicated the Taliban and were eager to show us that life in the regi…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: BC Bud
episodes.description: With a reported value of over six billion dollars, it’s no secret that pot in British Columbia is big business. However, due to the recent legalization of weed in Washington and Colorado, the draconian laws pushed forward by the conservative Canadian government’s omnibus crime bi…

episodes.title: BC Bud - Trailer
episodes.description: With a reported value of over six billion dollars, it’s no secret that marijuana in British Columbia is big business. However, due to the recent legalization of weed in Washington and Colorado, the draconian crime laws pushed forward by the Canadian Conservative government’s omni…

episodes.title: Lunch with the North Korean Basketball Team
episodes.description: After making basketball history playing alongside the North Korean National Team, VICE correspondent Ryan Duffy and the Harlem Globetrotters sat down for a meal with the North Korean players. They discussed highlights from the game and their reactions to the surprise appearance o…
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: The World Is Sinking - Preventative Measures
episodes.description: VICE co-founder Shane Smith explores global warming by talking to leading experts about what can be done to save the world from the impending disasters that are caused by rising water levels.
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Senegalese Laamb Wrestling's Marabout Ritual
episodes.description: The most popular sport in Senegal isn’t soccer—it’s laamb, combining Greco-Roman wrestling moves with eclectic pre-fight rituals and dances. Laamb’s appeal has skyrocketed as the nation’s economy has plunged, and the top stars are the Michael Jordans of their country. In this seg…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Kicking Heroin with an Ibogaine Ceremony
episodes.description: Heroin is the most addictive drug on earth, and some people will do anything to kick the habit. Enter Ibogaine, a drug made out of the African iboga root, whose intense, hallucinogenic properties make it a type-A felony drug. But many swear it's the most effective way to kick her…
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Tobaccoland
episodes.description: The tobacco industry in Indonesia is virtually unregulated. The result? Over two-thirds of all men are smokers, and it is commonplace for children as young as six to take up the habit. Tobacco is a $100 billion industry here, with TV and print ads everywhere. While investigating
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Strolling the Thames in China
episodes.description: VICE correspondent Ryan Duffy takes a stroll with some tour guides through Thames Town in Songjiang, China. The British-style town is part of the "One City, Nine Towns" plan that China has established for the outskirts of Shanghai.
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: Egypt on the Brink - Women Under Assault
episodes.description: VICE co-founder Suroosh Alvi meets with some local activists around Tahrir Square to learn about the horrible conditions female protesters have been put in while their country has been turned upside down.
episodes.author: Suroosh Alvi

episodes.title: Meet Kalpana Saroj, India's Dalit Queen
episodes.description: VICE co-founder Shane Smith meets real-life slum-dog millionaire Kalpana Saroj, who was once a Dalit at the very bottom of the Indian caste system and earned only pennies a day in a sweatshop. She eventually became a talented tailor, making $5 every day, and then miraculously ros…
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: The Fat Farms of Mauritania
episodes.description: In Mauritania, a country crippled by food shortages, obesity is viewed as a sign of wealth and prestige in a woman. To attain Mauritanian standards of beauty, many women undergo the practice of 'gavage,' or "fattening up." While traditionally the practice of fattening includes ch…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Chinese Cockblock - The Sex Doll Factory
episodes.description: With 50 million more men than women, the sex industry in China is growing rapidly. For episode five of 'VICE' on HBO, we went to a sex-doll factory in the city of Dalian to see the effects of the uneven dating landscape.
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Mormon Lost Boys - Nikita's Story
episodes.description: During our time in Colorado City, Arizona, we met 16-year-old Nikita Timpson, who spoke with us about her life in the Fundamentalist Church of Latter-Day Saints and her upbringing in a polygamous family.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Mormon Lost Boys - Lorin's Story
episodes.description: Lorin Holm was excommunicated from the Fundamentalist Church of Latter Day Saints in 2011 following an edict from imprisoned leader Warren Jeffs. He invited us into his home for a first-hand look at the house he once shared with his three wives and 25 children.
episodes.author: Ryan Duffy

episodes.title: America's Most Heavily Armed Church
episodes.description: Pastor Larry Allen is the pistol-packing preacher who runs the New Life Baptist Church and Academy in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The church is protected by an ex-police security team and all of the students are warriors when it comes to gun safety drills and procedures. In this cli…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: European Meltdown - The New Face of French Nationalism
episodes.description: Amidst the economic strain in France, the far right Front National party has experienced a resurgence in popularity. In this clip that we shot for episode four of 'VICE' on HBO, Shane meets the new faces of French nationalism and the successors of the Le Pen lineage, Marine Le Pe…
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Grocery Shopping for North Korean Defectors
episodes.description: Thousands of North Koreans cross the border illegally into China every year. If they are arrested in communist Laos, there’s the possibility of being sent back to North Korea, where they face prison camps or worse. We recently met up with a South Korean pastor who moves defectors…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Pakistani Dress Up
episodes.description: Before heading out to the Line of Control that divides India and Pakistan, Shane decides to buy the local garb—shalwar kameez—to fit in.
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Going on a Raid in Bajaur
episodes.description: While shooting in Bajaur, Pakistan—considered the main refuge and supply route for Taliban insurgents—Shane gets a firsthand look at what a raid operation with Bajaur scouts looks like.
episodes.author: Shane Smith

episodes.title: Escape from North Korea - Hanawon Resettlement Center
episodes.description: Before a defector can officially become a member of South Korean society, he or she must complete a program at the Hanawon Resettlement Center. Thomas Morton sits down with the Director of Education to get a glimpse into the crash course that transforms defector into denizen.
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: 'Chonto' by Carson Mell
episodes.description: Bobby Bird is a tattooed, drug-addled songwriter who idolizes himself more than everyone and everything, except for his pet monkey, Chonto. He is a menace. A lover. A genius. A failure. Bobby Bird is “the Devil In Denim.”

episodes.title: An Interview with Writer and Director Carson Mell
episodes.description: Created from the mind of writer/animator/director Carson Mell, Chonto is the animated tale of Bobby Bird's greatest failings and also, possibly, his greatest accomplishments.

episodes.title: 'Dumpy Goes to the Big Smoke' by Mirrah Foulkes
episodes.description: Attempting to navigate a world filled with cats and dead-end ideas, a frumpy woman named Dumpy is shocked into action when a handsome stranger crashes into her warehouse.
episodes.author: Mirrah Foulkes

episodes.title: An Interview with Director and Actress Mirrah Foulkes
episodes.description: Dumpy Goes to the Big Smoke is Mirrah Foulkes' first short film. It won some awards at Aspen Shortsfest, Sydney Film Fest, and Flickerfest.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: An Interview with Janicza Bravo and Brett Gelman About 'Eat!'
episodes.description: Here's a little behind-the-scenes interview about how Eat! came to be with director Janicza Bravo and actor Brett Gelman.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: 'Eat!' by Janicza Bravo
episodes.description: After getting locked out of her apartment, a young woman finds herself in the company of a strange and lonely neighbor. Eat! is a short film directed by Janicza Bravo and starring Brett Gelman and Katherine Waterston.
episodes.author: Janicza Bravo

episodes.title: 'The Lark' by Gil Kenan
episodes.description: It’s a simple story: man meets woman, woman falls in love (?), they get married, man takes advantage, woman puts up with it, man goes too far, and woman finally snaps.
episodes.author: Gil Kenan

episodes.title: Director Gil Kenan Talks About His Short Film, 'The Lark'
episodes.description: At the only screening of Gil’s 2004 UCLA Senior Thesis film The Lark, a young agent spotted the short and sent it to his boss, which soon found its way into the lap of Robert Zemeckis. He loved the film and showed it to his producing partner Steven Spielberg.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Director Riley Stearns Talks About His Short Film, 'The Cub'
episodes.description: Riley Stearns was born in Austin, Texas. He used to write for Tower Prep on Cartoon Network and has made a couple other great and peculiar shorts starring his wife Mary Elizabeth Winstead called Magnificat and Casque. We recently sat down and had a chat about…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: 'The Cub' by Riley Stearns
episodes.description: Filmmaker Riley Stearns traveled deep into the woods to find his story. The Cub is the story of a five-year-old girl who's turned over by her middle-class parents to a pack of wolves to learn “strength, self-reliance, and cunning behavior." The girl is timid at first, clut…
episodes.author: Riley Stearns

episodes.title: 'Death to the Tinman' by Ray Tintori
episodes.description: A series of unfortunate events leads to Bill getting tin replacements for his arms, legs, and eventually the rest of his body, but he still has a human heart. Bill's new appearance scares away his love, Jane, who falls for his reincarnated heartless body. Will the rebuilt tinman
episodes.author: Ray Tintori

episodes.title: 'I Love Sarah Jane' by Spencer Susser
episodes.description: Ah, young love. The air seems clearer. The sun seems brighter. There's a spring in the step. Too bad about the zombie apocalypse.
episodes.author: Spencer Susser

episodes.title: 'The Ellington Kid' by Dan Sully
episodes.description: In a typical South London kebab shop Nathan tells Beefy a story. It's a story he's heard about the Ellington kid, who got stabbed and found refuge in the very kebab shop they are sitting in.
episodes.author: Dan Sully

episodes.title: 'Spider' by Nash Edgerton
episodes.description: I think everyone can relate to Jack, who's always running headfirst into things and not thinking them through. You can see the climax in 'Spider' coming a mile away, but when it comes, you realize objects far away are a lot bigger and more fucked than they appear.
episodes.author: Nash Edgerton

episodes.title: 'Bear' by Nash Edgerton
episodes.description: Jack has the perfect birthday surprise planned for Emelie. But sometimes plans go horrifically wrong.
episodes.author: Nash Edgerton

episodes.title: Series Trailer
episodes.description: We created this new Shorts series to release some of our favorite short films, including work by Nash Edgerton ('Zero Dark Thirty,' 'The Matrix'), Spencer Susser ('Hesher'), Ray Tintori (MGMT, 'Beasts of the Southern Wild'), and more. The first one airs Friday, February 1.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: 'The Lark' by Gil Kenan
episodes.description: It’s a simple story: man meets woman, woman falls in love (?), they get married, man takes advantage, woman puts up with it, man goes too far, and woman finally snaps.
episodes.author: Gil Kenan

episodes.title: VICE Eats with Action at Marea
episodes.description: Action is joined by friend and cousin by association, Big Body Bes, a self-proclaimed performer from Brooklyn. The duo pays a visit to NYC’s two-Michelin-star seafood restaurant, Marea, where chef Michael White cooks up an elaborate six-course meal.
episodes.author: Action Bronson

episodes.title: Serrano Shoots Cuba
episodes.description: Andres Serrano has come a long way since submerging a crucifix in his own urine. We followed the controversial artist around Cuba as he created a new body of work, photographing the country's influential figures, political leaders, the poor, the rich, and the dead.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Fourth Dimension
episodes.description: We teamed up with Grolsch Film Works and got three directors to make three short films about that most elusive and confusing of dimensions, the fourth. Then, we took their work and smooshed it into one feature-length film, which we think is about as close as one can get to the fo…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Reincarnated (ft. Snoop Dogg): Official Documentary Trailer
episodes.description: "Reincarnated" follows Snoop Dogg as he journeys to Jamaica to record an album with Diplo. While there, Snoop finds himself positively impacted by Rastafarian culture and reincarnated as Snoop Lion.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Kenny Powers's Newest Wet Dream
episodes.description: In which our buddy Danny McBride reprises his role as Kenny Powers reprising his role as K-Swiss's "MFCEO" to announce the release of a new line of shoes called Blades. With a guest appearance by Christy Karackas, animating KFP's "Speed" commercial for kids.

episodes.description: Get up, Ninja. Please get up.

episodes.title: Die Antwoord Live at The Creators Project Event
episodes.description: Die Antwoord ist die Art von Band, bei der du dich unweigerlich fragst, wie die Welt ohne sie überhaupt einmal funktionieren konnte.

episodes.title: Todcast: The Movie
episodes.description: Is Todd Richards, the once pro-snowboarder god, now a comedian/TV host/filmmaker?

episodes.description: Is Todd Richards, the once pro-snowboarder god, now a comedian/TV host/filmmaker?

episodes.title: VICE & Die Antwoord Present: Tokoloshe
episodes.description: The story goes that once you've slept with a Tokoloshe, you'll never be satisfied by a man ever again—it typically leads to divorce and basically ruins your life.

episodes.title: JACKASS 3D Behind the Scenes - Trailer
episodes.description: See what happens when the time-tested tradition of unhygienic pranksterism meet the technological wonders of three-dimensional film.

episodes.title: Drunk History - William Henry Harrison
episodes.description: In honor of the holiday, we present William Henry Harrison, the very first president to die in office—and from a cold.

episodes.title: Drunk History - Ona Judge
episodes.description: In honor of President’s Day, we present George Washington’s runaway slave Ona Judge, who showed up that wig-wearing, wooden-grill-having sack of shit.

episodes.title: Drunk History - Ben Franklin Continued
episodes.description: Benjamin Franklin’s greatest philanderings.

episodes.title: Drunk History - Ben Franklin
episodes.description: Ben and William Franklin discover electricity.

episodes.title: Drunk History - The Duel of Hamilton and Burr
episodes.description: Drunk History is a Howard Zinnesque exploration of the seamy undersides of American History.

episodes.title: Dear Diary
episodes.description: We crash Lesley’s pad on the eve of the release of her new Dear Diary compendium and steal her away to Connecticut with Chloe Sevigny.

episodes.title: Kings of Cannabis
episodes.description: You might not know who Arjan Roskam is, but you’ve probably smoked his weed. Arjan’s been breeding some of the most famous marijuana strains in the world for over 20 years. In 1992 he opened his first coffee shop in Amsterdam and has since crafted his marijuana-breeding skills in…

episodes.title: Kings of Cannabis - Trailer
episodes.description: You might not know who Arjan Roskam is, but you’ve probably smoked his weed. Arjan’s been breeding some of the most famous marijuana strains in the world—like White Widow, Super Silver Haze, and many others—for over 20 years. In 'Kings of Cannabis,' VICE joins Arjan and his crew…
episodes.author: Krishna Andavolu

episodes.title: Butane Hash Oil
episodes.description: Butane hash oil is made by blasting marijuana with butane, a solvent that takes all the THC with it and nothing else. Evaporating away the butane leaves only the resin, a viscous, amber-colored, waxy substance that can get you extremely stoned. Alas, every rose has its thorn, and…

episodes.title: The Wolfman
episodes.description: Eighty-year-old Werner Freund would rather be a wolf than a man. He's been raising and living with wild wolves in Germany for the last 30 years and considers them his family. Last January, Gersin Paya from VICE Germany and a small crew drove to the town of Merzig to meet Werner a…
episodes.author: VICE Germany

episodes.title: The Dog Hunter
episodes.description: In the close-knit world of dog hunting, Tom Varney is a legend, and he has the DVD sales to prove it. Tom is a former psychotic criminal who later found God and devoted himself to serving his fellow man. In a strange twist of morality, this led to his life's work: shooting wild d…
episodes.author: VICE Australia

episodes.title: The $wiftest Pigeon
episodes.description: China's spoiled young princelings aren't content with buying horses, sports cars, and insanely tacky watches alone. In tribute to the intrepid bootleggers who've propped up their country's market economy, China's rich have taken arguably the worst bird of all time, the pigeon, an…

episodes.title: The $wiftest Pigeon - Trailer
episodes.description: What is the sound of 1 million yuan flapping? China's spoiled young princelings have taken arguably the worst bird of all time, the pigeon, and slapped a Louis Vuitton logo on it. Racing pigeons are the new thoroughbreds here, with birds auctioning for hundreds of thousands of do…
episodes.author: Thomas Morton

episodes.title: Where Are We Headed?
episodes.description: In the last installment of this season of 'Young Americans,' we ask young people to talk about the scariest/most exciting thing there is—the future.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Cultural Stereotypes
episodes.description: We speak to folks from all over to tell us about what preconceived notions they might hold against other people.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Socializing
episodes.description: Barhopping, house parties, concerts, Facebook—how do you like to meet people?
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: LGBT
episodes.description: We ask young people about the gender pronouns, labels, and identities they use to define themselves.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Body Image
episodes.description: Food, beauty, health—we delve into these topics and get a glimpse into the expectations young people place on themselves today.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Media Representations
episodes.description: From movies, TV shows, commercials, to the internet, does today's media realistically portray our generation?
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: The Asian American Experience
episodes.description: Next up, we discover what outdated stereotypes and everyday experiences Asian Americans have to deal with today.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Coming to America
episodes.description: In the first episode of season two of 'Young Americans,' director Lance Bangs and his crew meet up with young people from coast to coast to discuss their multi-cultural roots.
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Season Two Trailer
episodes.description: In season two, ethnicity is the overarching lens through which Lance and his team focused in on some targeted topics such as body image, socializing, and media representations. The end result was a documented survey of people from a wide array of ethnic communities hailing from a…
episodes.author: VICE Staff

episodes.title: Part 8: Is the American Dream Still Possible?
episodes.description: For the final installment of the series, we put up for debate whether or not the age-old notion of "The American Dream" is still alive in 2012.

episodes.title: Part 7: Immigration
episodes.description: Living in the land of the free and the home of the brave, how much of an impact does the nation's immigration system have in our lives?

episodes.title: Part 6: Are We Too Divided About Politics?
episodes.description: In this latest installment, we discover how our blue-states-versus-red-states approach to politics affects American nationalism.

episodes.title: Part 5: Social Networking
episodes.description: In part 5 of the series, we ask how young adults these days approach the generation-defining platform of social media.

episodes.title: Part 4: The Economy
episodes.description: Real estate, jobs, college debt -- the U.S. economy in 2012 had a major impact in just about everybody's lives this year.

episodes.title: Part 3: Does It Matter Who the President Is?
episodes.description: Filmed during the leading months up to this year's presidential election, we take to the streets and the sidewalks to ask people if and how the Commander-in-Chief actually affects our lives.

episodes.title: Part 2: 24 Hours at Short Stop Deli
episodes.description: Next stop, we head to Ithaca, New York to learn more about the college town and the realities of the people who live there.

episodes.title: Part 1: What Is Your Life Like?
episodes.description: In part one of this eight-part documentary series, we met over a handful of young adults from across the country this past summer, finding out what they're doing with their lives these days and what their plans for the summer were.
